column1: Foxtail will feature:
<ul>
<li>
<b style=""font-family: 'Benton Sans', Helvetica, sans-serif
<li><b style=""font-family: 'Benton Sans', Helvetica, sans-serif
<li><b style=""font-family: 'Benton Sans', Helvetica, sans-serif
Leah, a young fox is embarking on a journey to visit her grandmother in a faraway mountain village. More than anything in her life, all she wants is to escape from big city problems.

Journey with Leah and step into her inner world, experience her interactions with others she meets on the way. Leah’s story was carefully developed to create a lasting emotional connection with you the gamer.

column4: >As you embark on your adventure you will discover how Leah is a deep and interesting character. She is a struggling soul and is challenged by her tragic personal story, which is revealed as you play. You’ll become emotionally invested and Leah’s experiences will be yours. You’ll fall in love with her.

column1: <span style=""font-family: 'Benton Sans', Helvetica, sans-serif
Foxtail is a beautiful world filled with wonder and amazement, but as Leah will discover not everything is what it seems, and there will be many dangers to navigate.

column2: >Our very own childhood memories with games like The Legend of Kyrandia, Monkey Island and King’s Quest hold a strong impression with us. It is that pixel aesthetic that we are trying to pay homage to with Foxtail. Everything within the game has been hand crafted: menus, characters, objects, scenes and so on. Foxtail is a true pixel adventure point n’ click game.

column1: <h3 style=""text-align: center

The incredible hand crafted pixel art and animation will no doubt appeal to those who spent time with point n’ click adventure games when they were younger. We do hope however, that we can introduce a new audience as well to our game. Pixel art for all!

Our team has plenty of experience working with pixel art and have done an amazing job in creating the world of Foxtail.

column2: >

column1: Story is a key piece to any adventure game, and the world of Foxtail is full of interesting characters and events. Every person you interact with has a background and a role to play.

column6: >Leah’s adventure is a personal one, but she will meet many colorful characters along the way that will request her help or friendship. Every decision that you make for Leah and others will have a lasting impact on the world itself.

column1: Foxtail would not be a classic point n’ click adventure game without challenging puzzles, and Foxtail will deliver in it’s own right. For the veteran of the genre we are offering a game mode called Without Prompting, which will remove any help assistance from the game.

Exploring Foxtail you will be working with objects, potions, finding hidden objects, solving logical conundrums and puzzles. You will also discover more about the world on your journey with stories and diary entries. Foxtail is filled with stories within stories, waiting for you to discover them.

Each new chapter will present more challenges as you progress in the story, for example in one chapter you will learn about herbalism and potions, and in another you will discover minerals or intricate ancient machines. The characters that inhabit Foxtail also have their fair share of problems that you can take the time to help them with to. Leah’s diary will guide your adventure, and there will always be something of interest in Foxtail.
<h1 style=""text-align: center

Funding Foxtail at the ""An Enigmatic Herbalist"" will earn you the DreamCo handcrafted Bow-Tie - as fashioned by the enigmatic Korsak the herbalist. Supporting Foxtail at ""The Traveller’s Best Friend"" perk will reward you with the Traveller’s Diary, a leather bound notebook similar to the one used by Leah in-game.
<h2 style=""text-align: center

Crafted from high quality materials the Traveller’s Diary would meet the standard of any curious adventurer. Record your own experiences on the high quality toned paper, and carry your own writing utensils with the clamps provided for pens and pencils. The cover is made of all natural leather and will protect and endure throughout your rugged adventures. A selection of pages from within the diary will also be decorated with pencil illustrations of herbs, minerals, folk and mythical characters from the colorful Foxtail world.
<h2 style=""text-align: center
Colorful, eccentric, and definitely unique, these Korsak stylish Bow-Ties by DreamCo are the perfect accessory for any Foxtail adventurer.
<h2 style=""text-align: center
€60,000 - “The Basic Gathering”
column5: >By reaching our funding goal you will be supporting the full-time development of Foxtail. This will allow us to pour all of our resources into finishing the game with our undivided attention and determination. The final game will feature more than 200 locations, over 50 challenging quests, and an occupied world of interesting characters. Foxtail will be available for Windows PC, Linux and MacOS.

column1: €80,000 - “Healer” FREE DLC At this level of funding we will be expanding the world of Foxtail with free DLC, that will follow the adventures of the cryptic herbalist, Korsak. Korsak’s story will take place 70 years before Leah’s, and will include many more interesting locations and characters.

€120,000 - “Travelling Party” With the full-time development and free DLC funded, at this level we will port Foxtail to mobile Android and iOS devices. The translation from desktop to mobile will require a new user interface, and other alterations to make the game an enjoyable portable experience, that you can take with you anywhere.
<h2 style=""text-align: center
<h2 style=""text-align: center
<h2 style=""text-align: center

There are risks with any crowd funded adventure, and Foxtail is no exception. Foxtail to us, is a pursuit of a dream that takes us back to the point n`clicks of yesterday, to the games that we enjoyed in all of their floppy disk, pixel art glory. We want to bring that dream to you, to entertain those who experienced these games when they were younger, and to animate a new generation of point n` click adventure lovers.

If we fund our goals we will be able to enter full-time development on Foxtail. This is really important to us as we could use the time to develop the aesthetic and significantly refine the Wintermute engine for our needs. Community funding is integral to our success. Thank you for taking the time to support Foxtail.
Foxtail arriving tentatively, in February 2017
","We can do it - TOGETHER!
Foxtail is not just a game. This is a dream. And dreams always come true.

Inspired by games of yesterday, Foxtail draws from such classics as Legend of Kryandia, King’s Quest and Monkey Island. True to the point n’ click genre, Foxtail is a wonderfully animated pixel adventure, with a deep personal story, and challenging puzzles.
For veterans of the genre, new adventurers, or kids, Foxtail is an unforgettable journey full of intrigue and wonder.
Greenlit

Foxtail has captivated the heart of the community, and was Greenlit on Steam in just 9 days! Support for our game has flooded in, with over 300 comments and nearly 400 subscribers. Foxtail gets daily email interest and the Greenlight page continues to bring in subscribers, comments.
Not familiar with €? No problem! You can pay with any currency:
The exchange range will be displayed on checkout.This works for credit cards, too.
Foxtail will feature:
More than 200 magically crafted locations
An in-depth and fascinating story
Creative and complex puzzles to solve
Meet Leah, a beautiful young fox.
Leah, a young fox is embarking on a journey to visit her grandmother in a faraway mountain village. More than anything in her life, all she wants is to escape from big city problems.

Journey with Leah and step into her inner world, experience her interactions with others she meets on the way. Leah’s story was carefully developed to create a lasting emotional connection with you the gamer.

As you embark on your adventure you will discover how Leah is a deep and interesting character. She is a struggling soul and is challenged by her tragic personal story, which is revealed as you play. You’ll become emotionally invested and Leah’s experiences will be yours. You’ll fall in love with her.
Foxtail is a beautiful world filled with wonder and amazement, but as Leah will discover not everything is what it seems, and there will be many dangers to navigate.

Our very own childhood memories with games like The Legend of Kyrandia, Monkey Island and King’s Quest hold a strong impression with us. It is that pixel aesthetic that we are trying to pay homage to with Foxtail. Everything within the game has been hand crafted: menus, characters, objects, scenes and so on. Foxtail is a true pixel adventure point n’ click game.

The incredible hand crafted pixel art and animation will no doubt appeal to those who spent time with point n’ click adventure games when they were younger. We do hope however, that we can introduce a new audience as well to our game. Pixel art for all!Our team has plenty of experience working with pixel art and have done an amazing job in creating the world of Foxtail.
Story is a key piece to any adventure game, and the world of Foxtail is full of interesting characters and events. Every person you interact with has a background and a role to play.

Leah’s adventure is a personal one, but she will meet many colorful characters along the way that will request her help or friendship. Every decision that you make for Leah and others will have a lasting impact on the world itself.

Foxtail would not be a classic point n’ click adventure game without challenging puzzles, and Foxtail will deliver in it’s own right. For the veteran of the genre we are offering a game mode called Without Prompting, which will remove any help assistance from the game.

Exploring Foxtail you will be working with objects, potions, finding hidden objects, solving logical conundrums and puzzles. You will also discover more about the world on your journey with stories and diary entries. Foxtail is filled with stories within stories, waiting for you to discover them.Each new chapter will present more challenges as you progress in the story, for example in one chapter you will learn about herbalism and potions, and in another you will discover minerals or intricate ancient machines. The characters that inhabit Foxtail also have their fair share of problems that you can take the time to help them with to. Leah’s diary will guide your adventure, and there will always be something of interest in Foxtail.
Supporter Gifts

Funding Foxtail at the ""An Enigmatic Herbalist"" will earn you the DreamCo handcrafted Bow-Tie - as fashioned by the enigmatic Korsak the herbalist. Supporting Foxtail at ""The Traveller’s Best Friend"" perk will reward you with the Traveller’s Diary, a leather bound notebook similar to the one used by Leah in-game.
Traveller’s Diary
Full size

Crafted from high quality materials the Traveller’s Diary would meet the standard of any curious adventurer. Record your own experiences on the high quality toned paper, and carry your own writing utensils with the clamps provided for pens and pencils. The cover is made of all natural leather and will protect and endure throughout your rugged adventures. A selection of pages from within the diary will also be decorated with pencil illustrations of herbs, minerals, folk and mythical characters from the colorful Foxtail world.
Korsak the herbalist’s stylish Bow-Ties
Full size
Colorful, eccentric, and definitely unique, these Korsak stylish Bow-Ties by DreamCo are the perfect accessory for any Foxtail adventurer.
Goals and stretch targets

€60,000 - “The Basic Gathering” By reaching our funding goal you will be supporting the full-time development of Foxtail. This will allow us to pour all of our resources into finishing the game with our undivided attention and determination. The final game will feature more than 200 locations, over 50 challenging quests, and an occupied world of interesting characters. Foxtail will be available for Windows PC, Linux and MacOS.

€80,000 - “Healer” FREE DLC At this level of funding we will be expanding the world of Foxtail with free DLC, that will follow the adventures of the cryptic herbalist, Korsak. Korsak’s story will take place 70 years before Leah’s, and will include many more interesting locations and characters.

€120,000 - “Travelling Party” With the full-time development and free DLC funded, at this level we will port Foxtail to mobile Android and iOS devices. The translation from desktop to mobile will require a new user interface, and other alterations to make the game an enjoyable portable experience, that you can take with you anywhere.
Team
Risks and Challenges

There are risks with any crowd funded adventure, and Foxtail is no exception. Foxtail to us, is a pursuit of a dream that takes us back to the point n`clicks of yesterday, to the games that we enjoyed in all of their floppy disk, pixel art glory. We want to bring that dream to you, to entertain those who experienced these games when they were younger, and to animate a new generation of point n` click adventure lovers.

If we fund our goals we will be able to enter full-time development on Foxtail. This is really important to us as we could use the time to develop the aesthetic and significantly refine the Wintermute engine for our needs. Community funding is integral to our success. Thank you for taking the time to support Foxtail.
Foxtail arriving tentatively, in February 2017",13.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Kyiv, Ukraine",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/foxtail-classic-point-and-click-adventure-game/pica

column2: >Ripples is a 2D puzzle game being developed for android and iOS by Virus Games.

>A young boy is out playing with his toy boat when something terrible happens … it stops working while its out in the water. To make matters worse the boy doesn’t know how to swim, the sun is about to set, and he needs to get home. To get his boat back the boy must use stones to create ripples to push the boat towards the shore, but that is easier said than done since the water is filled with obstacles.
column3: >Your screen taps are the stones and you must get the boat safely to the shore with limited stones and before time runs out!

column1: <ul>
<li>
<li>
Challenging levels
<li>
Built in puzzle maker to create your own puzzles
<li>
A puzzle upload to share your puzzles with the world
<li>
Free! The game is supported by unobtrusive ads that won’t interfere with gameplay

What Successful Funding Will Accomplish

Successful funding will not only help make Ripples a reality, but it will help a new indie company get its start. There are far more ideas waiting to be made into fun unique games that might be considered risky by established developers and publishers.
Any funding raised means a lot and shows that Virus Games has interesting original ideas that can be made into fun to play games.
For everyone that supports Ripples and Virus Games you have my sincere gratitude.

","What is Ripples
Ripples is a 2D puzzle game being developed for android and iOS by Virus Games.

A young boy is out playing with his toy boat when something terrible happens … it stops working while its out in the water. To make matters worse the boy doesn’t know how to swim, the sun is about to set, and he needs to get home. To get his boat back the boy must use stones to create ripples to push the boat towards the shore, but that is easier said than done since the water is filled with obstacles.Your screen taps are the stones and you must get the boat safely to the shore with limited stones and before time runs out!
The features that make Ripples special:
Unique Gameplay
Challenging levels
Built in puzzle maker to create your own puzzles
A puzzle upload to share your puzzles with the world
Free! The game is supported by unobtrusive ads that won’t interfere with gameplay
Who is Virus Games

Virus Games is a one man indie game development company that is focused on creating fun and interesting mobile games. Working entirely with original ideas Virus Games strives to make games that are different, that promote sharing, and that are not simple rehashes of existing games.
How the Funding will be Spent
Artist - $500
An artist is needed to design all the ingame assets to make the game look nice
Apple iOS developer Fee - $99
Google Play Fee - $25
Promotion - $125
The remaining amount will be used to promote the game
Any extra funds gathered will go into making the game better and increasing the promotion budget.
What Successful Funding Will Accomplish

Successful funding will not only help make Ripples a reality, but it will help a new indie company get its start. There are far more ideas waiting to be made into fun unique games that might be considered risky by established developers and publishers.
Any funding raised means a lot and shows that Virus Games has interesting original ideas that can be made into fun to play games.
For everyone that supports Ripples and Virus Games you have my sincere gratitude.

column2: ><b>During a visit to the United States last year filmmaker and educator Anthony Carlson met with Visionary Congolese PeaceMaker Neema Namadamu. Neema discussed

column1: her advocacy to bring real change to the Democratic Republic of Congo.
In 2011 Neema Namadamu founded Go

Network, a nationwide telecommunication solution for the Democratic Republic of Congo.

       Neema meets Angelina Jolie!

Exciting news! Coinciding with the launch of our campaign, Neema met with Angelina Jolie at The Global Summit to End Sexual Violence in Conflict. They were in strong agreement that the time for further talking is passed - it is time to act! As you know, Neema believes that technology can play a major role in ushering in peace in Congo, while also changing the future landscape for women and girls.

As the world has come together and declared that NOW is the time to act, it is MORE IMPORTANT THAN EVER that Neema garner support from the international community for her nationwide technology initiative.
column4:
>Please read on to learn how you can help.

  Click here to read more about Neema's meeting with Angelina Jolie
column5: >Testimony from a fan of Neema's, attorney &amp
column6: owner of Muffin Revolution, Marirose Piciucco
column7:
>

I am in awe of this beautiful &
column8: tireless woman and I hope you

column1: will donate to her Indiegogo campaign which will help pay for the
licensing fee for Go Network, an internet company that Neema started to
will help connect the more isolated eastern Democratic Republic of Congo

with the rest of the country.

Neema Namadamu has already built a
woman-owned and woman run media center in Bukavu, in the eastern DRC.
Through that center, hundreds of women have been trained on computers, in
internet literacy and, through World Pulse, have shared their stories
with woman around the world. Her organization, Maman Shujaa, means Hero
Women. It takes a heroic woman to rise up as Neema has and as the women
she works with have. I feel blessed to have met her while she was in the
U.S. and hope to cross paths with her again.
Much of Congo’s population
is isolated – completely cut-off from one another, their government, and
the world of enlightened, progressive and emerging peoples around the
globe. Too many children are without education and handicapped and indigenous children have no access to
education at all.
column3:
/>

Healthcare is another serious issue, especially in the

column1: rural and remote areas. Neema intends to connect the Congolese
population to the world, deliver online education, and telemedicine
support for the many ill-supported and staffed clinics and hospitals.
Finally, after three years working to
get this dream off the ground, all of the pieces are in place for Go
Network to introduce this vital technology-based solution to the nation.
Neema has been informed that Go Network
needs to pay a $150,000 license fee immediately or lose the right to deploy. That is the reason for this plea.
<h2 style=""text-align: center
How can telecommunications help in a conflict region such as the
Democratic Republic of Congo, a place the United Nations has deemed
“the most dangerous place to be a woman?”
<ul>
<li>
Internet connectivity – At present access to Internet for many
Congolese, especially women, is scarce to non-existent. Reliable
Internet connection helps on the ground relief organizations work
with greater ease and success. Social media plays a prominent role
in individuals and organizations raising awareness of their situation
through discussion, debate and accessing online resolution tools.
<li>
Mobile technology - Cell phones with wide ranging capabilities are
used in conflict areas to report violence against women and
children, as well as attacks on communities.
<li>
GIS Systems – Geographic Information Systems help track unstable
areas and activity at borders.
<li>
Telehealth – The delivery of healthcare services and access to on-line healthcare resources greatly improves through
telecommunications technologies. <b>Electronic Clinical Support
Systems - Computer-based knowledge management technologies
help clinicians in the delivery of healthcare from diagnosis and
inquiry through treatment and recovery.
<div>
<div>
<div>These are just a few ways that telecommunications in conflict areas help

to establish peace and bring aid to those in need.

Please support Neema
in her efforts to build peace in Congo.
Help to
fulfill her aspiration to connect her people to one another, important resources and knowledge, and you and I. We are asking for immediate and generous support in

making her vision a reality. 

Please donate and share this campaign with your friends, family and colleagues. As Neema says, ""I am not interested in making a little noise. I'm looking to change the paradigm.""

                 Thank you for joining us in changing the paradigm.
Without access to the world the most marginalized of Congo
will be left in the dark denied the opportunity to live in dignity.
Neema's
Indiegogo campaign is being managed by Team Member Carmen Stone. For
more information about Carmen scroll down to the Team section.

Neema is shown here meeting with UN Special Envoy Angelina Jolie and Foreign Secretary William Hague at the Global Summit to End Sexual Violence in Conflict in London. Photo Credit: Peter Muller

To learn more about Neema please visit her website
column2:
>Perks

At the $150 level - A beautiful purse handcrafted by the disabled Congolese seamstresses of Shakoshi. The smaller purse is shown on the left.

At the $250 level - The Shakoshi Sloop purse is shown on the right.

Protagonist Games

Protagonist Games was founded in 2011 by David Martin in order to produce fun and engaging tabletop roleplaying games for new and old gamers alike. Shortly after ProtGames started development of its first games, David decided to bring in Matthew Dolan as the Art Director for the company's games and other product lines in order to have more time to, as David often says, ""Make da games.""

David has been a gamer since he was first introduced to Battletech and the STAR WARS Roleplaying Game well over 15 years ago now. In that time tabletop gaming has become his passion as a hobby, and there is no other social and leisure activity he loves more than rpgs and tabletop games. He has worked in the tabletop gaming industry as a freelance writer for about three years now, doing work for Daring Entertainment, Iron Crown Enterprises, and others. In founding Protagonist Games, David hopes to bring his own unique stamp to the tabletop gaming industry and push the current boundaries of gaming.

Matthew has been an artist is entire life and recently found the inspiration to develop his art for the gaming industry. Recognizing Matthew's rising talent in art and visionary direction, David decided to bring Matthew onto the team after the RAWR! project had begun. Since then, Matthew has already left his own personal mark on the game. Matthew is now officially part of the ProtGames production team.

Now, in late 2011, their efforts are about to pay off. RAWR! The Monstrous Adventure Game is almost finished, and with a planned PDF release in December 2011, David and Matthew are looking for ways to bring RAWR! into the print world as well.
Learn more about Protagonist Games by visiting our website!

RAWR! is built on a simple 2D6 engine that adds the dice roll to a modifier against a target number. In other words, roll two six-sided dice, add them together, and add in your skill level. Then compare that number to a target number set by the gamemaster and you have your result.
It's that simple to play a game of RAWR!

But the game is not just for new or younger gamers. There is a depth to the monster creation system that experienced roleplayers will enjoy as well, combining a trait system with Monstrous Abilities in order to facilitate the creation of ANY monster that could ever be imagined.
Mission: Send RAWR! to the printer!

While much of tabletop gaming industry is moving into digital and PDF formats, there is still a strong and thriving print industry that local gaming stores rely upon. As well, gaming conventions such as GenCon, Origins, and others are a main income source for the majority of companies in the hobby industry.

Printing is not cheap, and our mission is simple. We need to raise enough money to cover the initial printing of RAWR! which will allow us to get it into local area gaming stores, take it to conventions, and share with the gaming community. The overall goal is to go from the ground up, growing the fan base of the game regionally and then nationally.
For all of that, we need your help.
You Help Us, We Give You Swag

This whole project can be as exciting for you as it is for us, and we hope it will be! We are not just asking for money. Well, we are asking for money, but we are also giving away awesome stuff when you give us said money. Our donation perks are positively packed full of awesome gear and gaming aids like t-shirts, Limited Edition D6 dice, custom dice bags, and posters! The more you give us, the more we give back to you!
Here's a look at the Limited Edition Monster Dice. Previews of the t-shirts, dice bags, and Land of Monsters poster will follow in future updates.
Spread the word and get other people excited about RAWR!
Let others know you donated to our campaign by clicking the share buttons to post to Facebook, Twitter, etc.
Thank you all for your support!
Note: Your name will be listed on a special page on our website, expressing our thanks, for any donation.

A c.irene Pop Up Shop in the Arcade

It has been a dream of mine to see the beautiful and historic Arcade, in the heart of downtown Cleveland, filled with independent shops again.  I've been given an opportunity to fill up storefront #156 from November 23 - December 23, and am reaching out to you for help in paying the rent and insurance, as well as supplies needed to help spruce up an empty storefront. 

As many of you may know, I have been selling my photographs at various outdoor markets and art festivals for almost two years.  It's hard work to set up a shop for a day, just to take it down several hours later, and nerve wracking to have to deal with Cleveland's weather for these outdoor markets.  But the excitement I see in people's faces when we discuss Cleveland's future at these markets is one thing that really keeps me going!  My little pop up shop might seem insignificant, but change has to start from somewhere.  And the Old Arcade is too beautiful a place to allow to sit empty any longer.  This opportunity will allow me to have a small taste of what it might be like to have a permanent space, in a building that is so important to Cleveland!
What I Need &
column2:
What You Get
  • The Rent for the month is $500, insurance is $100.  I'd also need to jazz up the storefront in a temporary way as it is not in move in condition, to put it mildly!

column1: • If this goal is met, I plan on having an opening party after I get settled in.  So you'll have a reason to come to the Arcade and stop in the shop!
• If this goal isn't reached in full, all funds received will still go to this project, and I'll just hope that the remainder magically appears :)
• Reduced priced perks if you contribute!

The Impact

  • Cleveland has made a great comeback, but there is still work to be done.  The Old Arcade is the first indoor 'mall' built in America.  It was built for small specialty shops to occupy the storefronts.  There are so many others like me who would be a perfect fit to bring life back to the center of Cleveland, so let's get this started!
Risks &

It's difficult to estimate the amount of sales I might make during this month long pop up shop, as it's a new venue for me.

  • The Arcade does not have much foot traffic, due to all the empty storefronts.
• I will have to purchase supplies to make this storefront welcoming and inviting.

• My goal is to not only make sales for myself, but to get people to see the potential this building has.  Without many other businesses in the building, it may be a challenge to bring people in!  I intend to pass out flyers to local businesses, use social media, and spread the word.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any help in any way will be so much appreciated!!

  • Spread the word!!!!!  Social media, word of mouth, texts, emails...

• Use the Indiegogo share tools!

<h3><span style=""background-color: initial
column5: >Hello, I am Chandos, owner of the new and fast growing European Mix League (EUML) for Team Fortress 2. I have been playing TF2 for some years now and recently found myself looking for a new format to try out. When I found no active European mix leagues, I figured to go ahead and design one. We take parts of a tournament style event and merge them with a casual mix. We are hoping to have a dedicated website to easily administrate and distribute the events, keeping record of players. General accessibility and order is what is lacking in many mix groups, so we hope to fix that.

column1: <h3><span style=""background-color: initial
column5:
>While we have already had a tonne of support from the community, I and a lot of my team are students, either unemployed or in a part time job. This is why we need you, the awesome community, to help us out and make a great site and system for both new and experienced competitive players!

What We Need:

column1: <div>
<ul>

• Money. While at this moment, we're not sure the exact figure, as quotes for web development differ greatly, we are confident that we can get this project in a user friendly and playable state with 500 Euros. The developers will fund what they can, but ultimately, it falls down to the community to make this happen.

• Support and Awareness. So far, we have had a huge deal of support from the community, and would like to see this go even further. Currently, we are backed by a dedicated TF2 Competitive community, but we would like to branch out to new players, as we are offering Debut leagues to practice, with advice and tips from veteran members of the community.
• Medals to be modeled and (hopefully) agreed by Valve to be distributed to the winners.
<ul>
• A fully working and user friendly website, professionally made and with Steam integration, as well as your standard Forums, IRC etc.
• A Mumble server to host everyone in the Mix Cups. This Mumble will be accessible to anyone who wants to play casual mixes through our website also.
• An awesome Prize Pool. Any money left over will be used to fund our first tournament.
Risks:
<div><ul>

• We need to keep the support going, if it falls through and no one uses our website and service, all the work will be wasted. To keep things alive, we will be hosting casual scrims, weekly, to keep awareness high until the website and service is complete.
• If the funding falls through, we simply won't be able to go ahead with the website and will have to keep the community far more casual.
How Else Can I Help?

Spreading awareness, both within the community and just anyone who might be interested in giving it a try. The more support, the quicker we will complete the project. Any volunteers for website coding, design or general help is much appreciated.
I hope we can make this work for a new and fresh twist to TF2 Competitive.
- Oliver 'Chandos' Boulton
","Needs You!

Hello, I am Chandos, owner of the new and fast growing European Mix League (EUML) for Team Fortress 2. I have been playing TF2 for some years now and recently found myself looking for a new format to try out. When I found no active European mix leagues, I figured to go ahead and design one. We take parts of a tournament style event and merge them with a casual mix. We are hoping to have a dedicated website to easily administrate and distribute the events, keeping record of players. General accessibility and order is what is lacking in many mix groups, so we hope to fix that.

While we have already had a tonne of support from the community, I and a lot of my team are students, either unemployed or in a part time job. This is why we need you, the awesome community, to help us out and make a great site and system for both new and experienced competitive players!   What We Need:

Money. While at this moment, we're not sure the exact figure, as quotes for web development differ greatly, we are confident that we can get this project in a user friendly and playable state with 500 Euros. The developers will fund what they can, but ultimately, it falls down to the community to make this happen.

Support and Awareness. So far, we have had a huge deal of support from the community, and would like to see this go even further. Currently, we are backed by a dedicated TF2 Competitive community, but we would like to branch out to new players, as we are offering Debut leagues to practice, with advice and tips from veteran members of the community.
Medals to be modeled and (hopefully) agreed by Valve to be distributed to the winners.
What You Get:
A fully working and user friendly website, professionally made and with Steam integration, as well as your standard Forums, IRC etc.
A Mumble server to host everyone in the Mix Cups. This Mumble will be accessible to anyone who wants to play casual mixes through our website also.
An awesome Prize Pool. Any money left over will be used to fund our first tournament.
Risks:

We need to keep the support going, if it falls through and no one uses our website and service, all the work will be wasted. To keep things alive, we will be hosting casual scrims, weekly, to keep awareness high until the website and service is complete.
If the funding falls through, we simply won't be able to go ahead with the website and will have to keep the community far more casual.
How Else Can I Help?

Spreading awareness, both within the community and just anyone who might be interested in giving it a try. The more support, the quicker we will complete the project. Any volunteers for website coding, design or general help is much appreciated.
I hope we can make this work for a new and fresh twist to TF2 Competitive.
- Oliver 'Chandos' Boulton",1.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Bude, United Kingdom",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/tf2-european-mix-league-project/pica

Vaults is a strategy card game, designed for 2-4 players and set in the
steampunk world. Each player assumes the role of crime lord with one
goal in mind: the pursuit for riches that are secured in locked vaults.
Plan your moves carefully, pick your crew, equip them with exotic tools
and send them to do what they do best. But not all vaults store riches
inside them. Even the simplest of vaults can result in a failed crack
and a trip to the police station for your crew of handpicked safe
crackers. To keep things even more interesting, players can gain access
to disrupt cards. These cards add another layer of tactic to the game
and can provide significant advantage to one player while causing all
kinds of problems to the carefully laid out plans of other players.
Challenge your skill and test your luck against Vaults to find out do

you have what it takes to become the true crime lord.

Deadbolt is an expansion pack for the Vaults card game. With Deadbolt 2 –
6 players compete to become the richest Crime Lord. On their journey to
the top they recruit professional safe crackers with various abilities
and skills.
Every good crew needs their specialized tools. But if things go wrong, it is always smart to have a getaway car nearby.
New vault cards offer many exciting options. Sometimes it is wise to
leave the loot in the Vault and use classified information to further
your cause.
With Deadbolt you are guaranteed more combos, more tactics and more fun!
• 30 Crew member cards – with numerous skills and abilities
• 8 Crew boss cards – each with their own unique ability
• 10 Disrupt cards – with multiple choice effects
• 20 Tool cards – no crew is complete without one

• 27 Vault cards – with different difficulty and crack outcomes
    +3 Vault cards aka ""The Beast"" - bonus
• 4 Turn Sequence cards
• 12 Crew member cards – with new skills and abilities
• 4 Crew boss cards – each with their own ability
• 7 Disrupt cards – with multiple choice effects
• 4 Tool cards – No more trips to the Police station with „Crookster“ – steam powered getaway car
• 15 Vault cards – with different difficulty and crack outcomes
<li>2 Turn Sequence / Action point tracker cards – yup, two more Crime lords at the table!
***Box design is not final

Since this is EU friendly campaign, EU backers do not have to worry

column1:
about customs.

Shipping will again be conducted via regular post since we had very
little complaints after the last campaign. Tracking is not offered
through this campaign. If tracking is important to you, please contact

us via the KS messaging system.

Since we had a couple of damaged games after last campaign this time
we will take additional special care of securing each and every package

for the hardships of shipping.

Shipments to non-EU backers will have 10 EUR declared as the value of
the package. That's roughly equivalent to 12 USD / 16 CAD / 16 AUD / 11
CHF / 1260 JPY and should be under the threshold that fall into customs
duties in most countries.

Works as one of the game designers/sales/writer/cleaner/cook at 4HOGS.

column1: Some things never change and he is still working on overpowered and
imbalanced ideas that we all love and cherish. Oh and yes, he is still

waiting for that Bat signal.

Works as 4HOGS CEO. It sounds fancy but what it really means is that he
spends most of his time cleaning after ScarHog's brainstorm/development
process. He is still our „go to guy“ when it comes to math and game

mechanic and he is always brewing new stuff for the future.

Works as an IT consultant and spends every free moment as a game
designer and writer. Together with ScarHog he gives charm and soul to
our every game. Lately his hobby is browsing through Webster dictionary,

eyeballing for a new word for us to learn.

Works as sound technician for the national radio station and like
GrammarHog spends his nights in front of the whiteboard. With his
unmatched experience with cheating…umm…exploiting, he works hard to

ensure that every prototype is well balanced.

SYÖKSYKIERRE-NICK ja muita menneiden aikojen huimapäitä sekä sankareita on jännittävä kerrontapeli vanhojen hyvien seikkailutarinoiden henkeä kunnioittaen.

Syöksykierre-Nick ei ole oikeastaan peli lainkaan. Paremminkin se edustaa tarinankerrontaa edistävää ja rohkaisevaa materiaalia. Syöksykierre-Nickiä käytettäessä kun ei pelata ketään vastaan eikä kenenkään puolella, siinä luodaan yhdessä hauskoja ja jännittäviä tarinoita. Hiukan niin kuin parhaissa roolipeleissä. Tosin kuin perinteisissä ropeissa, Syöksykierre-Nickissä ei ole kuitenkaan tarkkoja sääntöjä juuri millekään asialle. Siksi siinä ei ole myöskään voittajia eikä häviäjiä, edes siinä mielessä kuin joissakin roolipeleissä (joissa peliporukka voittaa vastukset ja ""pääsee loppuun""). Nopanheittoja tai hahmojen taitoja ei tarvita, koska sankarille kaikki onnistuu ihan niin kuin kertoja vain haluaa. Ainakin melkein... Muilla osallistujilla on nimittäin mahdollisuus haastaa kertoja tämän tarinoiden aikana. Yllättävästi esitetyillä haasteilla saadaan juonenkulkuun niin jännitystä, outoja ja uusia käänteitä kuin myös ennenkaikkea mahtavaa tarinaa!

SYÖKSYKIERRE-NICK sopii melkein mille tahansa pelaajamäärälle. Ehkä parhaimmillaan sen ryhmäkoko on sellainen, jossa jokainen pääsee helposti osallistumaan. Tämä taas riippuu suuresti kertojan ja muiden pelaajien aktiivisuudesta ja mielikuvituksesta, joten hyvä määrä on jossakin kolmen ja kahdeksan välillä. Mikään ei tietysti estä tarinoimasta kahden tai vaikka kymmenen hengen porukassa.

SYÖKSYKIERRE-NICKIN pelaamiseen on muutama vaihtoehtoinen tapa. Plus ne monet omat tavat, joita jokainen peliporukka voi keskenään kehitellä. Syöksykierre-Nick kirjanen esittelee kaksi tapaa ovat ""sankariporukka"" ja ""idolia kuuntelemassa"". Pelaajat voivat kokeilla ja soveltaa näitä valmiita tapoja, tai voivat kehitellä aivan omanlaisensa tavan sankarillisten tarinoiden esittämiseen.
Osoita samaa rohkeutta kuin suosikkisankarisi. Hanki SYÖKSYKIERRE-NICK, ennekuin on myöhäistä!
Kirjanen sisältää
<div><ul>

• Ohjeistukset sankaritarinoiden kertomiselle, missä pelaajat haastavat toisiaan esittämällä kysymyksiä tapahtumien kulusta. Kertoja reagoi näihin juonen muutoksiin sekä lisäyksiin keksimällä hyvää jatkoa.
•  Kaksi eri tarinankerrontatapaa, ""sankariporukka"" ja ""idolia kuuntelemassa"".
• Taulukoita ammattien, tapahtumapaikkojen, haasteiden jne. keksimisen helpottamiseksi.
Tekijät
<div>

Syöksykierren-Nickin kirjoittaa legendaarinen Risto ""Nordic"" Hieta, jonka ansioihin kuuluu muunmuassa MikroBitti-lehden ""Peliluola""-palstan pitäminen ja roolipelijulkaisut The Secret Treasure of Raguoc in the Acirema Dungeons, Miekka ja Magia, Rapier, Astra, Elhendi, Roolipeliopas, Kalmo, Väinö D20, Lännen maat sekä Valon maa. Hänet on myös palkittu Ropecon-tapahtumassa Kultaisella lohikäärmeellä elämäntyöstään.

Julkaisijana toimii D-oom Products, joka aloitti julkaisemalla Lohikäärmeliiton englanniksi (Dragon Union) ja jatkoi siitä omilla julkaisuilla. Nykyään D-oom Productsilla on myös verkkokauppa, missä oman tuotannon lisäksi hän myy myös muiden julkaisuja.
Kuvituksesta vastaa Hans Zenjuga, pelitaiteen veteraani.
Formaatti
<div><ul>
• Kirjasen koko: A5, 6x11"" tai vastaava
• Sivumäärä: 20 - 30
• Mustavalkoinen kuvitus

Riskejä ja haasteita

Aina saattaa olla jotain, mikä menee pieleen. Suurimpia riskejä ovat:
<ul>
• Kirjoittaja tai kustantaja ei jostain syystä voi toimittaa työtä loppuun, jolloin julkaisu viivästyy toisen ratkaisun etsimisen ajaksi
• Julkaisu viivästyy

Muita tapoja tukea

Jos et halua tai pysty tukemaan kampanjaa suoraan rahoittamalla sitä (saaden vastineeksi oman painoksen pelistä), voit jakaa tätä kampanjaa eteenpäin! Kukapa ei haluaisi tarinapeliä entisaikojen sankareista!
Mutta ei huolta, vaikka rahalliseen tavoitteeseen ei päästäisikään, Syöksykierre-Nick tapahtuu silti, ja tukijat saavat oman kappaleensa joka tapauksessa.

column1: <h4 style=""text-align: center

column4: >Sa bai dee to you! (which means hello in Laos)
column5: >My name is William Soukkachang.
column13: >  (Or you can call me""Tho""if you like.)
column15: >I am the founder of <a href=""http://soukkachanggames.wordpress.com/"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><span>Soukkachang

column1: Games and the only developer currently working on this project.
I love to laugh and enjoy life.
<h4 style=""text-align: center
you ask?
Super Six Card Game is
a 4 player game that uses the standard 52 card deck. Super Six Card
Game consists of 6 rounds played. The first initial 4 rounds will dictate
if you will qualify into the last 2 rounds.
In the beginning of
the game, you are able to bet a certain amount of credits, in which all the
players have agreed upon.
Example: Everyone
agrees to bet 5 credits, then that is 20 credits in the pot.
to play dangerously right?!
So here are the
detailed rules of the game. (If you don't like reading, then watching the
video below explains most of the rules.)
column2: >(This video has the old UI layout)

column1: The first person who
initiates the game becomes the dealer. The dealer deals 6 cards to each player.
This person also goes first
column2: thereafter the winner of each round goes

column1: first.
The dealer puts down
any card, playing it face up in the middle of the playing area. The other
players in turn must play a card of a higher value and of the same suit, that is, if they want to beat this card. Those who have no card of the suit played, plays
any card they choose face down. Card values are ranked highest to lowest
When all the players
have played one card, the first round is complete. Whoever played the highest
card of the suit that the first player played is the winner of the round.
Next, the cards played
are not gathered in but remain in a face up pile.
The winner of the
round then leads any card from his/her hand to begin the next round. He/she plays that card face up on top of the pile.
Then the same procedure happens again. Where the other
players must each play a card: this must be a higher value and of the same suit
as the card that was led, if possible, otherwise any other card.  You do this until four rounds have been played. The winner of
these first 4 rounds qualifies to be a participant in the last two rounds.
This is where it gets
really fun! It is basically the same concept as the earlier rounds but instead
of playing one card, you play two.
For example, the
winner of round 4 starts round 5. That person must now put the last two cards
that he/she has, on top of each other, in the order that he/she wants them to
be played.
This is done for all
the qualifying players. The players then show their hands and whoever wins the top card, leads the final sixth round, which is the bottom card. Exciting right?! Whoever
wins that last round wins the whole game and gets all the credits in the
pot!

column6: >I've been constantly updating my progress on my website and Youtube channel. And I will continue to update the progress in the future.
column7: >To sum up the project status for now:

column1: Funds contributed will
be used for artwork to polish up the final version and web hosting. This means, in the

future, I can add a player database and in-game currency. Also I would like to create an in-game store where players are able to buy things with their credits (player customization). The funds received here will

contribute to the capability of betting in games as well. I assure you that I will do my best not to waste your money and spend the money only on where it needs to be. Also in future releases, I want to implement a single player mode with artificial intelligence so you can practice while waiting on other players to join the lobby. The funds will also go into developing that as well.
As of current, this

game is able to run on any browser that supports HTML5 such as the latest versions of Google Chrome, FireFox, and Internet Explorer. But that is not enough, I would like to have a dedicated ""Super Six Card Game"" app in various apps stores so the game will run smoother and have a broader audience. With that being said, the funds generated here
will help port this game to other platforms such as iOS and Android. This will
make it possible to expand the audience of Super Six Card Game.
What you get:
<ul>
<li>Every donation will be thanked publicly on our website!
:D (unless you choose to remain anonymous)
<li>Most of the perks consist of mainly receiving in-game
credit.
<li>New users will start out with 50 in-game credits, so
get a head start and donate so you will receive more than that.
• Credits can be used in game to bet with and also out of game, they can be used to enter into our monthly drawing for prizes. (Prizes will vary,)

If you really want to start out ""Super"" fresh, then you will get to receive one of these shirt designs.

 Design 1:
The impact you will
have on this development is that you will make it very possible for this game
to come out the best it could have been.
Seeing that there has
been a huge success in the ""Poker"" market had made me realize that
there is a very great possibility for a huge success in the ""Six Card""
market.
This is the vision I
see. I hope you see it too.
“An artist is not paid
for his labor but for his vision.""
- James Whistler
Yes, this will be the
first game of its kind. So invest!
I
really appreciate you taking the time to look at my project! Even if you can't
donate any cash, I'd really appreciate it if you could spread the love by
sharing and liking our Facebook page:

column2: >Like and Share Super Six Card Game
column3: >

column1: interwebz, and help others know that Super Six Card Game will become the best
it can WITH THEIR HELP!

column1: ","↑ You can help me by sharing this campaign！ Thank you! ↑A playable demo is available here!Try Super Six Card Demo Now!(It need four players to start.)(If you want, open up four instances of the game in browser to test play as four players to get a feel for the game.)
Who Am I?

Hello fellow supporters & prospective participants, Sa bai dee to you! (which means hello in Laos)My name is William Soukkachang.    (Or you can call me""Tho""if you like.) I am the founder of Soukkachang
Games and the only developer currently working on this project.
I love to laugh and enjoy life.
So... what is ""Super Six Card Game""
you ask?
Super Six Card Game is
a 4 player game that uses the standard 52 card deck. Super Six Card
Game consists of 6 rounds played. The first initial 4 rounds will dictate
if you will qualify into the last 2 rounds.
In the beginning of
the game, you are able to bet a certain amount of credits, in which all the
players have agreed upon.
Example: Everyone
agrees to bet 5 credits, then that is 20 credits in the pot.
Nice! Who doesn't like
to play dangerously right?! :P
So here are the
detailed rules of the game. (If you don't like reading, then watching the
video below explains most of the rules.)(This video has the old UI layout)
The Rules:
1. Deal
The first person who
initiates the game becomes the dealer. The dealer deals 6 cards to each player.
This person also goes first
column2: thereafter the winner of each round goes

column1: first.
2. Play
The dealer puts down
any card, playing it face up in the middle of the playing area. The other
players in turn must play a card of a higher value and of the same suit, that is, if they want to beat this card. Those who have no card of the suit played, plays
any card they choose face down. Card values are ranked highest to lowest
When all the players
have played one card, the first round is complete. Whoever played the highest
card of the suit that the first player played is the winner of the round.
Next, the cards played
are not gathered in but remain in a face up pile.
The winner of the
round then leads any card from his/her hand to begin the next round. He/she plays that card face up on top of the pile.
Then the same procedure happens again. Where the other
players must each play a card: this must be a higher value and of the same suit
as the card that was led, if possible, otherwise any other card.  You do this until four rounds have been played. The winner of
these first 4 rounds qualifies to be a participant in the last two rounds.
3. Last Two Rounds
This is where it gets
really fun! It is basically the same concept as the earlier rounds but instead
of playing one card, you play two.
For example, the
winner of round 4 starts round 5. That person must now put the last two cards
that he/she has, on top of each other, in the order that he/she wants them to
be played.
This is done for all
the qualifying players. The players then show their hands and whoever wins the top card, leads the final sixth round, which is the bottom card. Exciting right?! Whoever
wins that last round wins the whole game and gets all the credits in the
pot!

VERY NICE!!! :D------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Project statusI've been constantly updating my progress on my website and Youtube channel. And I will continue to update the progress in the future.To sum up the project status for now: System:# 60% of the system are done. The game is already playable. Try Super Six Card Demo Now!(It need four players to start.)(If you want, open up four instances of the game in browser to test play as four players )(This video has the new UI layout)Content:# 3 of 6 stages design are done, 4rd and 5th in progress.# 50% of must-have environment objects ( art ) are done.
What We Need & What You Get
Funds contributed will
be used for artwork to polish up the final version and web hosting. This means, in the

future, I can add a player database and in-game currency. Also I would like to create an in-game store where players are able to buy things with their credits (player customization). The funds received here will

contribute to the capability of betting in games as well. I assure you that I will do my best not to waste your money and spend the money only on where it needs to be. Also in future releases, I want to implement a single player mode with artificial intelligence so you can practice while waiting on other players to join the lobby. The funds will also go into developing that as well.
As of current, this

game is able to run on any browser that supports HTML5 such as the latest versions of Google Chrome, FireFox, and Internet Explorer. But that is not enough, I would like to have a dedicated ""Super Six Card Game"" app in various apps stores so the game will run smoother and have a broader audience. With that being said, the funds generated here
will help port this game to other platforms such as iOS and Android. This will
make it possible to expand the audience of Super Six Card Game.
What you get:
Every donation will be thanked publicly on our website!
:D (unless you choose to remain anonymous)
Most of the perks consist of mainly receiving in-game
credit.
New users will start out with 50 in-game credits, so
get a head start and donate so you will receive more than that.
Credits can be used in game to bet with and also out of game, they can be used to enter into our monthly drawing for prizes. (Prizes will vary,)
If you really want to start out ""Super"" fresh, then you will get to receive one of these shirt designs. Design 1:Design 2:
The Impact
The impact you will
have on this development is that you will make it very possible for this game
to come out the best it could have been.
Seeing that there has
been a huge success in the ""Poker"" market had made me realize that
there is a very great possibility for a huge success in the ""Six Card""
market.
This is the vision I
see. I hope you see it too.
“An artist is not paid
for his labor but for his vision.""
- James Whistler
Yes, this will be the
first game of its kind. So invest!
Other Ways You Can Help
I
really appreciate you taking the time to look at my project! Even if you can't
donate any cash, I'd really appreciate it if you could spread the love by
sharing and liking our Facebook page:
Like and Share Super Six Card Game
^^ Add me on Instagram ^^All over the
interwebz, and help others know that Super Six Card Game will become the best

it can WITH THEIR HELP!Awesome! And that’s all there is to it. Thanks again for looking at Super Six Card Game. Your view is very much appreciated! ""Remember, don't just sit there... be part of the movement!"" - William Soukkachang",8.0,2,"1 Campaign

Mortis is a multiplayer shooter developed by Deadghost Interactive.
It will soon be released on Steam and you can buy it here on
Indiegogo for a discount of 25% along with unique perks. By
contributing to our campaign you´re helping us to keep on doing what
we love. Making games!
Explore
a vibrant world based on steampunk and old fairy tales!
Choose
between 6 characters, all with an unique ability! Vlad can lunge
through the sky, Wild Card can slide on the ground and Rouge has a
radar as an advantage.
Your
arsenal consist of 12 weapons with an alternative attack, some even
has two! Rouge's gun uses magnetic bullets, the cannon can kill
several enemies in one shot and the claws can shoot magic
projectiles.
Compete on 4 maps with their own theme. Castle Transylvania offers combat in
close quarters and the Red Queens flying ship is a level with lots of
height differences. Please
note that Wonderland has been replaced with a new level that adds
more diversity to the game.
Unlock
new abilities using your skilltree and become an even more deadly
foe. Upgrade your weapons, learn new powers or get access to
grenades!
Fabula
Mortis will be released for Pc and Mac and supports English language.
The
money we collect will be used to improve Fabula Mortis and for each
goal we will add a new and exciting weapon to the game. If we collect
more than 6000 dollars, that money will be used on new computers,
licenses and salaries for our next project.
Administration
is the cost for running the campaign and the business, this includes
handling taxes, planning and administration. Extra expenditure is
money reserved for office supplies, travels and so on. Safety is for unforeseen events like changes in the currency or illness.
Fees includes fees to Indiegogo and creditcard companies, it´s based
on 7%. The fees to Epic can reach 5%.
Deadghost
Interactive is an independent company located in Sweden. The team
consists of four employees that studied at PlaygroundSquad in Falun.
We started our own company during this time and was accepted into a
business incubator called Stiftelsen Teknikdalen. We have worked as
consults developing game concepts for Region Dalarna. The team have
been exhibitors on Gamex and LAN Estrad were visitors could play a
demo of Fabula Mortis. During our education and sparetime we have
been involved in several project and have worked with Pc, PS3, Amiga
and smartphones.

Indiegogo?

a small indie company we are depending on the support from our fans

will I get my perks?
The
game will most likely be released in October, however, you will get
your keys as soon as possible.
<b>Why
flexible funding?
We
can complete the game even if we don´t reach our goals.
<b>What
happens if the fundraiser fails?
The
game will be completed according to our feature list and you will
receive your perk. We will continue to update the game but new
content will be sparse.
<b>What
if you have miscalculated your costs?
Our
expenses are based on the actual cost and  development time on
previous weapons. We have also added 10% to our total cost, this is
safety for example changes in currency.
<b>How
can I help?
We
would really appreciate if you buy a perk and share our post on our
facebook page. Telling all your friends is also a great help. If you
wish to contribute in another way just go for it!

Our Story

""Fake Shemping"" is a method of creating supporting characters for tabletop roleplaying games from existing characters or even real people. The term was coined by film director Sam Raimi, and is based one of The Three Stooges, Shemp Howard. Shemp died while still under contract to Columbia Pictures. The Stooges completed four short films using existing footage, body doubles, and other trickery. Many of you are probably familiar with the Tim Burton film
column2: >Ed Wood, where Bela Lugosi died during the filming of
column3: >Plan 9 from Outer Space and was replaced by Wood's wife's chiropractor. Same thing.

column1: Shemping in roleplaying games includes recycling characters, reskinning monsters, and renaming familiar characters from movies, comics, and novels. But there's more, so much more. The book details a number of techniques for designing memorable and useful supporting characters with minimal effort, based on over 30 years of gamemastering experience.

column2: >The Compleat Shemp is expands upon a series of articles that originally appeared in Open Game Table: The Anthology of Roleplaying Game Blogs, Vol. 1.

column1: ","Our Story

Fake Shemping"" is a method of creating supporting characters for tabletop roleplaying games from existing characters or even real people. The term was coined by film director Sam Raimi, and is based one of The Three Stooges, Shemp Howard. Shemp died while still under contract to Columbia Pictures. The Stooges completed four short films using existing footage, body doubles, and other trickery. Many of you are probably familiar with the Tim Burton film Ed Wood, where Bela Lugosi died during the filming of Plan 9 from Outer Space and was replaced by Wood's wife's chiropractor. Same thing.

Shemping in roleplaying games includes recycling characters, reskinning monsters, and renaming familiar characters from movies, comics, and novels. But there's more, so much more. The book details a number of techniques for designing memorable and useful supporting characters with minimal effort, based on over 30 years of gamemastering experience.
The Compleat Shemp is expands upon a series of articles that originally appeared in Open Game Table: The Anthology of Roleplaying Game Blogs, Vol. 1.
What We Need & What You Get

The book is going to be completed one way or another. Funding just gives me incentive to prioritize this project ahead of others, rather than ""whenever I get around to it"". After release, the prices will go up, so if nothing else preordering save you money. Any excess funds will be rolled over to finance future projects.
If you've already contributed to the project via my the ""Donate"" button on my website, you're grandfathered in for a preordered book & pdf! I'll contact you for your mailing information.
Other Ways You Can Help

Soon I'll be setting up an author page on Facebook, and you can ""Like"" it and spread the word to others! Follow me on Twitter (Berin_Kinsman) and hit me with some #followfriday love! Visit my blog (BerinKinsman.com) subscribe to the RSS feed! Leave comments on my blog posts! Tell your friends!",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns

SCALE
We makes choice that they are big goblins heroes, this will be better for painters. We wanted to keep a lot of details... :)
Scale in centimeters
HIGH QUALITY RESIN
Miniatures are casted in France by ""GRX Creations"", known for the outstanding quality of his work. Working with this kind of professional is an excellent guarantee of quality.
We chose not to use metal for some simple reasons :
<ul>
• Resin miniatures are incredibly much more detailed !
• After miniatures coating, rendering and paint resistance are excellent and better, especially for the players.
• Lighter Miniatures, which lowers shipping costs !

column1: DA CLASH CROSSOVER
Skulls Mini join Ammon Miniatures and their Da Clash Game with two Strech'Gobz : Tazzer'Gob et Gob'Rabbit !!
After their release, these miniatures will be playable in Da Clash. They will meet Gobleon and his friends in this awesome cocktail game !
Da Clash Game is available right now at Skulls Mini WebShop
<div name=""aboutSM"">
<div name=""WAW"">
Who are we ...?
Skulls Mini was launched in Miniature World for over a year now. Our first project was The Miniatures from The Unicorn, licenced by Delcourt France.
Our goals are simple :
<ul>
• To always produce the highest possible quality miniatures.
• To have the best contact, and an excellent customer service.
<div name=""WFU"">
Who follow us ?

In order to obtain the highest quality miniatures, it seemed obvious that working with renowned actors was essential. However, we have not neglected the emerging talents from the miniature scene. Let me introduce them :
◢ Sculpture
<ul>
<li>
MIKH : Gob'Da and Sergeant'Gob
<li>
Valentin ZAK : Wonder'Gob and Torch'Gob
<li>
Patrick MASSON : Gob'Ninja
<li>
Benoit CAUCHIE : Grumpy'Gob
<li>
Christian HARDY : Aqua'Gob abd Hammer'Gob
<li>
Tom HUGUES : Tazzer'Gob, Super'Gob and Tree'Troll

• Highlight to Stéphane CAMOSSETTO, who sculpted most of Gob'z'heroes: Big'Eye, Dragon'Gob, Gob'tective, Big'Red, Snot'Gob, Gob'Rabbit, and Troll'Thing. He will be chief sculptor in charge of BriK A BraK Episode 2, in cooperation with Mohammad Hossein Attaran.
◢ Design
<ul>
<li>
Stephano Moroni : He is the pencil of original concepts. Decisive in this project development, he was the first I worked with, around a simple idea ...
<li>
Jean-Michel BRISSET : He realized every colorizations of Stephano's original concepts.
<li>
DarkElixir : StreetGraphist at his firsts, a really talented artist who allow me to apprehend different views about Gob'z.
<li>
Adrian Prado : He currently work for Bigchild Creative, Adrian make us an Episode 2 preview, in a beautiful scene.
◢ Paint
A bit special, because these peoples gave their hands in the project. They painted with passion and were friendly invested in the project. It seemed very important to us to name them :
<ul>
<li>
Martin Goumaz for his unbelievable diorama, Maxime Corbeil the Turtle, Nicolas Rouanet aka Juan, Yohan Leduc, Amon Chakai, John Keys,
column2: fref=ts"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">John Harrison, Jean-Marc Brisset, and Laurent Bons

column1: • We confess we had the chance to work with Sergio Calvo, who painted GOB'DA. I offer my thanks to him, has he has not a lot of free time :-)
<div name=""SMPres"">
And Skulls Mini, Who, When, How ?
Let me introduce myself. I am ""Antonioooh"" online, and called Antoine ROFFE (in real life!). What I have done for this project? Well, not so much ... :)

I'm not very good to introduce myself. I was mostly very lucky to have the chance to work with all of these people !! Surely I am behind the project, by the countless hours devoted, but without the investment of all, this project could not have been carried out ...
-  Special Thanks  -

A little special thanks to someone who created the first Brik A Brak, who followed and supported me, who translate me (as my English is not very high, especially written), and with who I shared the project from the beginning : Cécil HIS-MAHIER. This project is from him too ...             ""Merci à toi mon pote""
<div name=""WhyEuros"">
WHY EUROS ?
Pledges are in Euros, as we are based in Europe and everyone could simply make a credit card payment through PayPal.
You don't even need to own a PayPal Account !!
PayPal will automatically convert your currency in euros. It is as simple as reliable !
<div name=""shipping"">
SHIPPING
You must add shipping fees to your pledges ...
We hardly tried to create ""shipping include"" pledges and to be honest, we figured out that there will be too many issues to find a clear and fair solution for everyone
column2: mainly looking at other previous campaigns ...

column1: So, we worked to reach the lowest shipping fees as we could. You will just have to add for each pledge, corresponding shipping fees :
To France (Zone 0) :

column2:
>If you take at least two pledges, only apply once the Gob'Chief fees ...
It seems really simply to us, but if you have a doubt, fell free to ask !

column1: <div name=""RiskChallenge"">
RISKS AND CHALLENGES
This miniature range is our first project of this magnitude.
Our goal was to produce wonderful miniatures. We had to !
... and I hope we succeed !

We took big risks to get to this point, by our investment, both personal and financial. Many people have not heard of us yet. The challenge is just more exciting : provide a great product and convince you to remain into the project. Why that ?
Brik A Brak, it is 3 episodes :
<ol>
<span style=""color: #6E6E6E
• Gob'z'heros
• Gob'robots
• Gob'vilains
If this episode is a success, the second one will launched as soon as possible (April or May), the third one will follow, and a game is scheduled for the end of the year. A real BRAWL GOB GAME ! ^^
WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT TO MAKE 2015 ...
<h2 style=""text-align: center
... A GOB'YEAR  !!
<div name=""GeneralPurpose"">
FOR GENERAL PURPOSE
More information about our concepts and miniatures :

All these interpretations are parodies and painting works reflects personal interpretation of each artist. We sell unpainted resin miniatures and without paint. Our miniatures are costumed Goblins, paints can be applied to create your own Gob'z'heroes ...
Miniatures are casted with polyurethane resin (PU) and contain very small parts.
Products not suitable for children under 4 years old.

More about Strech'Goals...
The next soon...
BACKGROUND
SUPPORT US
If you want to share with your friends and use our colors !!
PLEDGE, SHARE & GET Miniatures for FREE
More information from Indiegogo : ""How to participate in a referral Contest""
DA CLASH CROSSOVER
Skulls Mini join Ammon Miniatures and their Da Clash Game with two Strech'Gobz : Tazzer'Gob et Gob'Rabbit !!
After their release, these miniatures will be playable in Da Clash. They will meet Gobleon and his friends in this awesome cocktail game !
Da Clash Game is available right now at Skulls Mini WebShop
Who are we ...?
Skulls Mini was launched in Miniature World for over a year now. Our first project was The Miniatures from The Unicorn, licenced by Delcourt France.
Our goals are simple :
To always produce the highest possible quality miniatures.
To have the best contact, and an excellent customer service.
Who follow us ?

In order to obtain the highest quality miniatures, it seemed obvious that working with renowned actors was essential. However, we have not neglected the emerging talents from the miniature scene. Let me introduce them :
◢ Sculpture
MIKH : Gob'Da and Sergeant'Gob
Valentin ZAK : Wonder'Gob and Torch'Gob
Patrick MASSON : Gob'Ninja
Benoit CAUCHIE : Grumpy'Gob
Christian HARDY : Aqua'Gob abd Hammer'Gob
Tom HUGUES : Tazzer'Gob, Super'Gob and Tree'Troll

Highlight to Stéphane CAMOSSETTO, who sculpted most of Gob'z'heroes: Big'Eye, Dragon'Gob, Gob'tective, Big'Red, Snot'Gob, Gob'Rabbit, and Troll'Thing. He will be chief sculptor in charge of BriK A BraK Episode 2, in cooperation with Mohammad Hossein Attaran.
◢ Design
Stephano Moroni : He is the pencil of original concepts. Decisive in this project development, he was the first I worked with, around a simple idea ...
Jean-Michel BRISSET : He realized every colorizations of Stephano's original concepts.
DarkElixir : StreetGraphist at his firsts, a really talented artist who allow me to apprehend different views about Gob'z.
Adrian Prado : He currently work for Bigchild Creative, Adrian make us an Episode 2 preview, in a beautiful scene.
◢ Paint
A bit special, because these peoples gave their hands in the project. They painted with passion and were friendly invested in the project. It seemed very important to us to name them :
Martin Goumaz for his unbelievable diorama, Maxime Corbeil the Turtle, Nicolas Rouanet aka Juan, Yohan Leduc, Amon Chakai, John Keys, John Harrison, Jean-Marc Brisset, and Laurent Bons
We confess we had the chance to work with Sergio Calvo, who painted GOB'DA. I offer my thanks to him, has he has not a lot of free time :-)
And Skulls Mini, Who, When, How ?
Let me introduce myself. I am ""Antonioooh"" online, and called Antoine ROFFE (in real life!). What I have done for this project? Well, not so much ... :)

I'm not very good to introduce myself. I was mostly very lucky to have the chance to work with all of these people !! Surely I am behind the project, by the countless hours devoted, but without the investment of all, this project could not have been carried out ...
-  Special Thanks  -

A little special thanks to someone who created the first Brik A Brak, who followed and supported me, who translate me (as my English is not very high, especially written), and with who I shared the project from the beginning : Cécil HIS-MAHIER. This project is from him too ...             ""Merci à toi mon pote""
WHY EUROS ?
Pledges are in Euros, as we are based in Europe and everyone could simply make a credit card payment through PayPal.
You don't even need to own a PayPal Account !!
PayPal will automatically convert your currency in euros. It is as simple as reliable !
SHIPPING
You must add shipping fees to your pledges ...
We hardly tried to create ""shipping include"" pledges and to be honest, we figured out that there will be too many issues to find a clear and fair solution for everyone
column2: mainly looking at other previous campaigns ...

column1: So, we worked to reach the lowest shipping fees as we could. You will just have to add for each pledge, corresponding shipping fees :
To France (Zone 0) :
Gob'Da : 6 €
Gob'Novice : 6 €
Gob'Confirmed : 6 €
Gob'Manager : 7 €
Gob'Chief : 7 €
To Europe (Zone 1) :
Gob'Da : 7 €
Gob'Novice : 7 €
Gob'Confirmed : 7 €
Gob'Manager : 8 €
Gob'Chief : 8 €
To International (Zone 2) :
Gob'Da : 7 €
Gob'Novice : 7 €
Gob'Confirmed : 7 €
Gob'Manager : 9 €
Gob'Chief : 9 €
If you take at least two pledges, only apply once the Gob'Chief fees ...It seems really simply to us, but if you have a doubt, fell free to ask !
RISKS AND CHALLENGES
This miniature range is our first project of this magnitude.
Our goal was to produce wonderful miniatures. We had to !
... and I hope we succeed !

We took big risks to get to this point, by our investment, both personal and financial. Many people have not heard of us yet. The challenge is just more exciting : provide a great product and convince you to remain into the project. Why that ?
Brik A Brak, it is 3 episodes :
Gob'z'heros
Gob'robots
Gob'vilains
If this episode is a success, the second one will launched as soon as possible (April or May), the third one will follow, and a game is scheduled for the end of the year. A real BRAWL GOB GAME !  ^^
WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT TO MAKE 2015 ...
... A GOB'YEAR  !!
FOR GENERAL PURPOSE
More information about our concepts and miniatures :

All these interpretations are parodies and painting works reflects personal interpretation of each artist. We sell unpainted resin miniatures and without paint. Our miniatures are costumed Goblins, paints can be applied to create your own Gob'z'heroes ...
Miniatures are casted with polyurethane resin (PU) and contain very small parts.
Products not suitable for children under 4 years old.
