Check out our perks on the right hand side of the page. Any contribution helps, and we want to make sure its worth your while.
The Impact
Real democracy, by the people. Let's change the equation in Washington. Let's make it easier to represent our will. Let's encourage good government and public service.
By providing accessibility, transparency, and engagement in Congress, Capitol Bells will help create a more perfect union. Capitol Bells will help make every voice count EQUALLY.
Other Ways You Can Help
You can still make a huge difference if you can't contribute
Share the campaign with your friends
Download the app from iTunes
Tell your friends again
Questions?
If you have any questions about the app or the campaign, feel free to give me a shout out on Twitter or Facebook.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Washington, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/capitol-bells-mobile-congress-real-democracy/pica

History
Have you ever felt like this?: You get a new piece of
equipment, then you have to dream up ways of making it more efficient. Last summer we got an Allen &amp
digital sound mixer! It was amazing! Good quality sound, easy-to-use controls.
BUT, often we needed to control it remotely. A&
worked with “apple”, which we didn’t have. At this point the brainstorming began.
Some hours later we had made a simple interface to control the input channels. There
was no stopping us now! There were more and more new needs and ideas:
equalizer, outputs, etc.
Now we have a software with working functions (mixing,
load/store scenes, customize channel labels and colors, 4 channel PEQ, Mute,

Panorama, etc.). You can download it from Google Play.  

We have even more ideas to make it extra efficient:
make a customizable interface, develop
all other functions. Sadly we have no way to use the mixer for developing and
testing purposes. That’s why we started this project. We would like to make a
professional software for QU owner sound engineers. Please help us with a donation
to finish our project. We need your support, to buy essential equipment (QU
mixers, developing and testing tabs/phones) and to finance other development
costs. .
This software will stand out from all others. Our goal is to make a
customizable interface which can perform every need. Are you the main mixer?
Are you the monitor mixer? Just create and interface with the function you
need. Unique interface for music, vocals, etc.
The application will be modular, so future it can be used with
other mixers.
There will be a free app, which will be available for
download at Play Store, so more people can access it. It contains the essential
features. For professionals there will be a pro version which will include all
features. The pro version will cost about 45 USD. The price will help us to
develop up-to-date software. In this way we will get feedback and new ideas for
further improvements.
The majority of the donations will go towards
the purchase of QU mixers (16, 24 and 32), to test, and troubleshoot, and buy
test equipment.
If the target is exceeded by 50% (because of the high price of mixers), we can begin to develop this software for Allen&
column2:
Heath GLD and iLIve series also. So GLD and iLIve useres are also welcome!

Functions:

  •  works on different screen sizes (minimum recommended screen: 720p@4”’)

column1: • set channel label
•  set channel label color
• set channel fader color
• setup channels you wanna’ use
• dynamic channel position(Input 3 can be the 5th channel on the screen)
• hide channel
• reload default channel label with double touch
• long faders
• reload default fader position with double touch
• 4 channel PEQ for each channel with diagramm
• reload default 4 channel EQ with double touch
• faders to set channel PEQ width
• faders to set channel PEQ frequency
• 28 channel GEQ for output
• load and store EQ presets
• reload GEQ fader to 0 dB with double touch
• Channel Mute
• Panorama fader for input channels
• set panorama to default position with double touch
• channel delay
• channel compressor
• phantom power switch to each channel
• gain for inputs
• level meter for inputs, and outputs
• draw GEQ curve
• channel gate
• siwtch on/off HPF
• linking stereo channel
Follow us: facebook.com/touchandmix

So why do you want my money, you greedy bastards?

We are two guys from Sweden who try to make our dream come true. One of us is a professional programmer, the other one is a military pilot and non-professional programmer. But thats not important. What's important is the dream.
Ok ok, whats the dream?
To create a mobile game based on gps, sort of like ""king of the hill"" but in real life. Like this:
And how will you do that?
Its already done! We made it! its working great! It's called ""TURF - outdoor addiction"".
Err.. ok? So what do you want from us then?
Right now, we want to introduce the game to the United Kingdom!
But it's an app, just release it in the UK then?

No can do! The game is free of charge, got no ads, and it takes lots of manual work to expand to new countries, make zones everywhere and make the neccessary marketing. Plus new servers and all the other stuff the users never notice.
Trust us, we know from the previous expansion in Scandinavia.
So your plan is to make a great, free, game and make absolutely no money from it?
Well, yes and no. Personally we need no money since we got real nice jobs already. But the project needs funding. Especially servers and marketing doesn't come for free.
Ok, the cause might be legit. But is the game any fun?

It sure is! Imagine a game where people WANT to bike, run, walk, inline, board around several hours every day. It's got to be giving some adrenaline and fun to the users in order to accomplish that. Did we mention Turf has been in loads of newspapers, radio, national tv, etc.?
Well, either it's fun or the swedes are crazy. Where do i do more research on the game?
Turf Official webpage
Turf on google play
Lots of statistiics from the game
Nice, I might read that later. Will I be able to play it on my phone?
Yes, if you have an Android or iPhone. The Android version is already released. The iPhone version is currently in an early, playable, alpha-version.
I like it, but what do we get if support you?
Well first of all, you obviously get the perks that we listed. But we got some extras of course:
if we do not reach our goal
<ul>
• We will use all the money to try to expand to the UK using cheap tricks.
if we reach 1000€
<ul>
• The UK will have servers placed in the region to ensure great speed and stability.
• We will assign zonemakers who prioritize the UK, in order to ensure great infrastructure in the game.
• We will give awesome prizes to the winners in the UK.
• We will market the game in the UK.
If we reach 2000€
<ul>
• We will hold an official TURF Bonanza contest somewhere in the UK.
• We will give even greater prizes to the winners in the UK.
Any final sales pitch?
We work hard, have a great product, but we need you!
Oh yeah, one more thing...what is a ""zone""?

Zones are very crucial to the game. Zones are specially prepared geographical places that you can take using your phone. Everyone playing can see when you take them, and take them back from you.

ou wake up in a world named Cerryst and sense a strong elemental presence around you. Somehow you feel strangely connected to one of them.
Clueless how you got there, your instincts tell you that you need to survive.
Sensing other beings around you, either friend or foe, you decide to start exploring the world around you.

Be the strongest...

...mage in the Zodiac Unleashed universe. Grow in power as you craft items, kill enemies and build your base.
Choose from a variety of weapons, spells and a items to best suit your playing style.

Zodiac unleashed will be a medieval, fantasy style, online shooter where players control a powerfull mage.
The primary goal is to stay alive, how you do this is up to you.
column4:
/>

First person action in multiplayer games up to 40 players

column1: • Spellcasting. Use a large variety of spells to kill enemies or help allies.

• Real life overlap. Your zodiac sign, the current month and time will influence the gameplay. Choose from the elements and pick the best moment for your attacks and spells to get the most out of them.
• Day - night cycle. When better to launch a surprise attack on you enemies or sneak around and steal their items then during the night. With the day - night cycle all is possible.

• Weather effects. Ever tried to cast a fireball in a snowstorm?
    Sounds hard right? Zodiac unleashed provides the most realistic gameplay using different kinds of weather: Snow, rain, fog and sunshine

• Don't starve. Everyone needs to eat, including your character. Keep him alive by exploring the world, finding food and water and survive just a little longer.Free roam. Walk around exploring, searching for items or just killing enemies. The world will be filled with various zones (city, swamp, forrest etc), monsters and enemy players.
• Extensive crafting. There will be lots of items to be found and used to craft new weapons and spells.
• Build a base. Gather items and resources to build various buildings to improve your strength.
• Play multiple servers. Characters are stored per server, allowing you to play multiple characters with different stats.

... and get involved in the early development stages. Help us develop this game by backing this project and help us make sure this game will reach its full potential.

If you don't have any money to spend you can also help us by telling friends and family about this project. If you can't do this, but have skills creating magnificent art, sound or 3d models we'd certainly appreciate any help we can get and we like to hear from you.

We are a small team of indie developers registered as Cellgames.
From our home base in The Netherlands we work our magic, bringing this game to life. We all have a different educational backgrounds in the respective fields of Software development, Game development and Graphical design and we are currently looking for new partners with other proficiencies.

Flexible funding?

Since we are already developing the game, all the money received will speed up the process. Every dollar will improve the game (both visually and technically) and push forwared the release date. It enables us to buy quality content or hire specialists on very specific subjects (like creating cool background music, making fire, water and lighting look pretty etc)

withFire aims to change lives through gaming. It is a company established to donate a portion of profits to community-chosen charities beginning at 35% from the first game. The plan is to begin developing games for mobile devices and to push out into the PC and console markets as the company grows. 

Who is withFire?

My name is David Saxon and currently I'm a one-man team but I plan to expand into a small team in the future. I'm from Wellington, New Zealand and am a recent graduate of computer science. Basically, I love making games.

Why not give more than 35%?

The plan is to donate 35% of all profits to charity and to increase this percentage as the company grows. The rest of the money will go towards keeping the company afloat and expanding the team.

Which charities will withFire support?

That's the best part - the charities will be chosen by the community (to an extent, we don't want the money going to someone's personal charity to pay their rent... lol). The charities will be chosen online through a suggestion and voting system.
column7:
/>

Disclaimer: This is nothing like curling.

Extreme Curling is the first game withFire will release. In this game you must dodge obstacles, collect power-ups and coins, get crazy speed from boosts, and hit sweet jumps in order to get the farthest possible distance. The game will be free-to-play and free of advertising.

What features are in the game?

There are two main game modes:

column1: • High Score mode: You compete against a global score board to hold the farthest distance reached on a procedurally-generated course.
<li>Challenge mode: You must complete objectives (such as hitting all speed boosts) on increasingly difficult courses.<span style=""line-height: 1.45em
Extreme Curling will also have an in-game store where you can spend coins collected in levels to purchase new things such as:
• Areas: New areas to go extreme curling in such as a frozen river, a volcano, or 80's Sci-Fi.
• Curling stones: More curling stones with improved abilities such as legs for better manoeuvring, helicopter blades or wings to get more air, and armour for better survival.
• Power-ups: Add additional power-ups to the game to make it even crazier!

What platforms will Extreme Curling be released on?

It is currently being developed for Android devices, but any money above the funding goal will be used to bring the game to iOS devices.

Why does Extreme Curling need my money?

The foundation of the game is complete but there is still a lot more to be done. The game requires an in-game store, more curling stones, more levels, better effects, and more music and sound effects before its release.

What is Omicron?

You may have noticed in the trailer that Extreme Curling is powered by Omicron. Omicron is my own engine for Android that I have been working on for the past year. Ideally it will eventually be available for public use.
column3:
/>

Wallpapers: $5+

Get a set of digital wallpapers of Extreme Curling.

Official Soundtrack: $35+

Get a digital copy of the Official Extreme Curling Soundtrack plus the music from the promo video.

T-shirt: $75+

Get either a withFire or Extreme Curling T-shirt. If you purchase this perk just leave a comment to specify which one you prefer, your size, and whether you would like the male or female style.

Both T-shirts: $150+

Get both the withFire and the Extreme Curling T-shirts. Wear both at once and you can look twice as cool.

Major Funder: $250+

Be listed in the credits as a funder of Extreme Curling and withFire.

Design a Curling Stone: $500+

Got an idea for an extreme curling stone. Work with withFire to design a curling stone that will be available to use in the game. 5 to be claimed.

Design an Area: $1000+

Work with withFire to design an area that is playable in the game. 2 to be claimed.
column6: >Other than contributing, the biggest thing you can do is share this campaign. Indiegogo has some great sharing tools you can use.
column7:
>You can also make sure to check out and share Extreme Curling once it's released.

withFire on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/gameswithfire

withFire on Google+: https://plus.google.com/b/109574611963719520930/109574611963719520930/about

column2: >SUPERSTRUCTURE is a game like no other. Card driven, and utilizing miniature construction materials, 2 to 6 players race to complete their structure in spite of Strikes, Foreclosures, and petty theft from their fellow players. Children and adults are on equal footing with this game. Never a boring moment.

>Everybody can use some fun and laughs. Superstructure provides plenty of both. Whatever the amount, your backing goes to bringing a little extra happiness into the world. No card game, board game, or electronic game provides its combination of intense interplay and the tactile satisfaction of actually building something.

>Roger Scott Jackson (RoSco) has worked as a teacher, a reporter, and advertising man. But before he did any of those things, RoSco designed games for a living. Not a very lucrative living, but just the same, he was at it for sixteen years. In all, RoSco has designed sixty-seven games, most of which have never been published.

Cari Park has always been handy with tools. Most of her working life has been engaged in carpentry and cabinet-making. She hand crafts the game pieces and the wooden box they come in.

column1: <span class=""notranlsate""><span class=""notranlsate""><span class=""notranlsate"">We fabricated the first ten
games using home shop tools. While these are adequate for small quantities, we
will need to invest in some larger and sturdier equipment, and add a few
dedicated machines, to eliminate the need to reset for different operations.
This will allow us to streamline production and achieve greater uniformity. Our
first priority is a drill press, and then a second table saw for dado cuts. A
dust collection system will also be required for the shop.
expressions of heartfelt thanks, to hand-crafted models, to actual
Superstructure games. The five remaining unopened copies of the original 1987 edition of
Superstructure will go to the first backers providing five hundred dollars or
more. For a benefactor who underwrites the entire fourteen hundred dollars
we’re looking to raise, RoSco will personally attend a Superstructure party for
you and your friends, delivering your copy, and bringing extras so that
everyone can play. Obviously, the logistics of travel will need to be worked
out.

column2: >Every dollar of funding will go to buying tools and

column1: materials.
business, back in the ‘80s, it was essentially impossible to produce short runs
of games
column2: or at least games with a suitable degree of polish,

column1: particularly those that used custom cards. RoSco feels like Rip Van Winkle, as
though he went to sleep in the dark ages of game publishing, and woke up in
this shining new future in which it’s feasible to do a small run of a few dozen or few hundred copies, replete with cards of absolutely top quality.

column2: >A good game is a practical joke

column1: that never gets old. Our aim is to design games that are
column3: > as well as fun to play, and whose funniness derives from the

column1: way the game causes players to interact, independently of the theme or what
it’s “about.” Not that there’s anything wrong with having a funny theme, but a
game is essentially a machine, operated by the players. It must work smoothly
and logically. Something meaningful should happen on every turn. It must reward
players for the sort of good-natured ruthlessness that makes a game like UNO so much fun to play. Superstructure is
easy to learn
column2: but, more than most games, it allows kids and grown-ups to

column1: compete equally. There’s no getting frustrated at being left behind. It always ends within about
sixty minutes, so there’s no chance of getting bored.
for some sixteen years RoSco was highly regarded within the toy industry, both
as a designer of quick-playing, easy-to-learn, incredibly interactive games,
and as a consultant whose crew of testers could be relied on to thoroughly
assess an unproven game’s market-readiness. RoSco’s deep appreciation of game
history and theory comes to life in each of his designs, and especially
Superstructure.

column2: >Whether or not you able to chip in, we can use your help in

column1: getting the word out. Please visit bestgamebuilt.com and check out
Superstructure for yourself. Encourage others to do the same. And as soon as
you’re in a position to do so, get your own copy. You’ll see. It’s absolutely
the maximum amount of fun that can be stuffed into a box. It's the best game built.

","SUPERSTRUCTURE is a game like no other. Card driven, and utilizing miniature construction materials, 2 to 6 players race to complete their structure in spite of Strikes, Foreclosures, and petty theft from their fellow players. Children and adults are on equal footing with this game. Never a boring moment.

Everybody can use some fun and laughs. Superstructure provides plenty of both. Whatever the amount, your backing goes to bringing a little extra happiness into the world. No card game, board game, or electronic game provides its combination of intense interplay and the tactile satisfaction of actually building something.

Roger Scott Jackson (RoSco) has worked as a teacher, a reporter, and advertising man. But before he did any of those things, RoSco designed games for a living. Not a very lucrative living, but just the same, he was at it for sixteen years. In all, RoSco has designed sixty-seven games, most of which have never been published.Cari Park has always been handy with tools. Most of her working life has been engaged in carpentry and cabinet-making. She hand crafts the game pieces and the wooden box they come in.
We fabricated the first ten
games using home shop tools. While these are adequate for small quantities, we
will need to invest in some larger and sturdier equipment, and add a few
dedicated machines, to eliminate the need to reset for different operations.
This will allow us to streamline production and achieve greater uniformity. Our
first priority is a drill press, and then a second table saw for dado cuts. A
dust collection system will also be required for the shop.
Our perks range from
expressions of heartfelt thanks, to hand-crafted models, to actual
Superstructure games. The five remaining unopened copies of the original 1987 edition of
Superstructure will go to the first backers providing five hundred dollars or
more. For a benefactor who underwrites the entire fourteen hundred dollars
we’re looking to raise, RoSco will personally attend a Superstructure party for
you and your friends, delivering your copy, and bringing extras so that
everyone can play. Obviously, the logistics of travel will need to be worked
out.
Every dollar of funding will go to buying tools and
materials.
When RoSco was in the toy
business, back in the ‘80s, it was essentially impossible to produce short runs
of games
column2: or at least games with a suitable degree of polish,

column1: particularly those that used custom cards. RoSco feels like Rip Van Winkle, as
though he went to sleep in the dark ages of game publishing, and woke up in
this shining new future in which it’s feasible to do a small run of a few dozen or few hundred copies, replete with cards of absolutely top quality.
A good game is a practical joke
that never gets old. Our aim is to design games that are funny as well as fun to play, and whose funniness derives from the
way the game causes players to interact, independently of the theme or what
it’s “about.” Not that there’s anything wrong with having a funny theme, but a
game is essentially a machine, operated by the players. It must work smoothly
and logically. Something meaningful should happen on every turn. It must reward
players for the sort of good-natured ruthlessness that makes a game like UNO so much fun to play. Superstructure is
easy to learn
column2: but, more than most games, it allows kids and grown-ups to

column1: compete equally. There’s no getting frustrated at being left behind. It always ends within about
sixty minutes, so there’s no chance of getting bored.
Though hardly a household name,
for some sixteen years RoSco was highly regarded within the toy industry, both
as a designer of quick-playing, easy-to-learn, incredibly interactive games,
and as a consultant whose crew of testers could be relied on to thoroughly
assess an unproven game’s market-readiness. RoSco’s deep appreciation of game
history and theory comes to life in each of his designs, and especially
Superstructure.
Whether or not you able to chip in, we can use your help in
getting the word out. Please visit bestgamebuilt.com and check out
Superstructure for yourself. Encourage others to do the same. And as soon as
you’re in a position to do so, get your own copy. You’ll see. It’s absolutely
the maximum amount of fun that can be stuffed into a box. It's the best game built.",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns

column2:
>About us

Meiko Miniatures is a small company producing high

column1: quality miniatures for Fantasy Football. We offer alternative designs to
the ones existing and we provide the players with a wide variety of
miniatures to help them complete their teams. To achieve this, we always

work beside the most talented sculptors.

You can see our full catalogue and contact us here: http://www.meikominiatures.com/

You
can also see our previous Meiko Lizardmen Campaign. That campaign
successfully ended on March 31st of 2013. All the packages were shipped
before June 30th, so in less than 3 months after the campaign ended up,

accomplishing the estimated shipment date of Late Spring 2013:

http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/meiko-miniatures-lizardmen-fantasy-football-team
Why crowdfunding?

Not so long ago, Meiko Miniatures released the Lizardmen Team, and we have been showing the initial greens of our next team, the Chaos Dwarf Team. All these greens are receiving good reviews from our customers, so we decided to release a whole Chaos Dwarf Team as soon as possible. The Chaos Dwarf Team will include: 6 Hobgoblins, 6 Chaos Dwarves, 2 Bull Centaurs, 1 Minotaur and 4 Star Players: Chaos Dwarf Blunderbuss, Hobgoblin Assassin, Bull Centaur Star Player and Minotaur Star Player. Also, this campaign will include several more items: Stunned / Prone markers for Bull Centaurs and Minotaurs, racial RR markers, racial Dice Bags, Chaos Dwarf Plastic Gaming Mat, racial Range Ruler, racial T-Shirts, Sprint Dice…

The sculpting of most of these miniatures has been already made. But we need your help to speed up the casting process. That way, we will be able to release the Meiko Chaos Dwarf Team much sooner than when was initially planned. Using Indiegogo as a platform to rise funds helps us a lot since we can finance new miniatures and other interesting items, obtain feedback from our customers and it gives us confidence to keep working on. In exchange you will get some cool rewards.

All the miniatures will be casted in metal, including the Chaos Dwarf Turn Counter and the Stunned / Prone markers. The master moulds will be made by Miniaturas Alemany, the mouldmaker of other successful Fantasy Football Indiegogo campaigns like the Chaos Team and the two Halfling Teams of Willy Miniatures.

All the miniatures include round bases. Each Chaos Dwarf and Hobgoblin comes with one 25 mm standard round base and each Bull Centaur and Minotaur comes with one 40 mm round base.

The scultptor of this Chaos Dwarf Team is Franarcilla, skilled sculptor of many other Meiko teams like the Ogre, Goblin, Rotter, Orc and Wood Elf Teams, just to mention some of them. He will also sculpt the Chaos Dwarf Turn Counter, a great accessory for a great team. Franarcilla is one of Meiko Miniatures flagship sculptors. His dark sculpting style specially fits with all the chaotic races, and his Chaos Dwarf minis will fit with the image we all have in mind when we think about Chaos Dwarves. Currently, Franarcilla is considered by many Fantasy Football fans as one of the best and most talented Fantasy Football sculptors worldwide.
column2:
>

NEW LEVEL!!!

Due to your expressed suggestions in different forums and though Facebook feedback, we have decided to make a new perk for our Meiko Chaos Dwarf Team. A more affordable team (just 75 EUR!!!) than the more complete options that we already had, but enough still to give our funders a minimum roster to complete their Chaos Dwarf Teams. This is the NEW 12 PLAYERS TEAM LEVEL!!! This Team will include 2 Bull Centaurs, 6 Chaos Dwarves and 4 Hobgoblins (Hobgoblin nº 1, 2, 3 and 4) .

This new level will be considered a Level 10 or higher in terms of Strech Goals. That means that everybody who gets this “12 Players Team Level” will get all the Strech Goals stated on the campaign. For example, if the campaign reaches  the 5.500 EUR,you will get for free a human size miniature (7’95 EUR retail price or lower), from the whole Meiko Miniatures catalogue, except on new released miniatures.

If you are a Funder who have already got other Perk options but you prefer this new perk instead, when campaign ends contact us to change it and you will be compensated with other perks of your choice, or be refunded with the difference to your Paypal account. Just choose the option you like the most.

Also, we have decided to change Level 14 (which was composed of 5 teams of 14 players) for a new version of Level 14 with 5 teams of 12 players… for just 350 EUR!!!! We hope these modifications will encourage you to support our campaign.

From now on, and as a Meiko trademark policy, it will not be possible to get any crowdfunded team with the same price or lower than the price stated on the campaign where the team belongs. This will be applied on all the online forums, all the online stores as Comixininos, other partners which distribute Meiko miniatures and also to the future Meiko Miniatures e-shop. We will not offer any discount or special offers for teams that come from a crowdfunding campaign. With this policy, we want to thank our backers their effort and trust in our crowdfunding campaigns.

In addition, the configuration with which the team will be commercialized once the campaign ends will not be the same as in the crowdfunding campaign. We want to reward our funders with an optimal configuration for any game so they can get the best for less money than after it will be funded. So the composition with which this team will be put on sale after the campaign can be not so complete as it is in the Indiegogo campaign. For example, team with 2 Bullcentaurs and Minotaur will be only available on Indiegogo. Once the campaign ends, they will never be commercialized together again.


In other words... it’s now or never, take advantage now!!! These low prices, team composition, Strechgoal Perks and worldwide FREE SHIPPING are not going to last much longer¡¡¡ Just during this Indiegogo campaign¡¡¡

We hope you make the most of this campaign and help us to get our goal.

Thanks for your support!!

We hope this level will help you to complete your team. Please let us know the number of the Hobgoblin that you wish after claiming this perk. It will be shipped together with your other perks of Level 3 or higher.If you wish two (or more) Hobgoblins to complete your team, you will need to claim two times (or more times) this Perk.In case you forget to let us know which Perk you wish, once the campaign ends up we'll contact you by e-mail to know which Perk you prefer.
LEVEL 3

You will receive one Chaos Dwarf Dice Bag made by Chaos Factory plus three Chaos Dwarf Block Dice or three Meiko Black Block Dice plus one Sprint Dice. The picture of the Block Dice shows 6 dice in order to show all the dice sides but only 3 are included. Free shipment included.LEVEL 4You will receive one Minotaur. In addition you will receive one Chaos Dwarf Turn Counter. Free shipment included.
LEVEL 5

You will receive one high-quality Chaos Dwarf T-Shirt made by Chaos Factory. Free shipment included.You will be able to choose the size of the t-shirt, among several options that we will give you. The color of the t-shirt will be always the one shown on the picture.
LEVEL 6
You will receive two Chaos Dwarf Bull Centaurs: one Bull Centaur nº 1 and one Bull Centaur nº 2. In addition you will receive one Chaos Dwarf Turn Counter. Free shipment included.
LEVEL 7
You will receive a Chaos Dwarf Plastic Gaming Mat and a Chaos Dwarf Range Ruler 1 mm Thick. Free shipment included.
The Chaos Dwarf Plastic Gaming Mat is printed in oilcloth, so it’s waterproof and you will be able to easily roll it for a comfortable transportation.

The Gaming Mat includes 2 Dugouts with their 3 sections: Bench, Unconscious and Dead-Injured. Also includes Re-roll, Turn and Score Counters, two Throw-in templates and two Quick Reference Lists with all the possible results of the Kickoff, 2 printed toothet wheels where players usually throw the kickoff, a colored Table to establish Ranges when throwing the ball, a Weather Table and a Scatter template.

The Range Ruler is made of flexible plastic and is 1 mm thick. That is the same thickness than a plastic Credit Card. Most of the surface of the Range Ruler is transparent, in order to allow you to see the miniatures located below.
LEVEL 8
You will receive six Chaos Dwarves, one of each model, all miniatures different. In addition you will receive one Chaos Dwarf Turn Counter. Free shipment included.
LEVEL 9
You will receive six Hobgoblins, one of each model, all miniatures different. In addition you will receive one Chaos Dwarf Turn Counter. Free shipment included.

column1: Developing a game requires a lot of time, dedication and effort.

With my past as a store manager for a big german computer chain I know very well how to dedicate myself to a task and with 2.5 years in which I spent most of my short spare time on developing this game I have already invested a lot of effort into this project.

The problem I need your help in solving is freeing up the time I need to concentrate more on Cars Incorporated. Most of the time I could spend developing this game for you I need to work on my regular job as a self-employed computer technican, so I have a roof over my head and enough to eat.

The target of this Indiegogo-campaign is to raise enough funds to allow me to focus on development for at least half a year, essentially turning this project into a full-time-job. Every penny earned through this campaign will go towards accelerating the development and will get the game into or at least close to the beta-phase (v0.80) in early 2014 for a targeted release in mid-2014 - a task which would likely take several years otherwise. Essentially you can put the development of this game on the fast track by backing it up. And you can come along for the ride, play through dozens of alpha and beta versions, give feedback and ideas and help make this your game.
What happens if the campaign fails?

Contributions towards the campaign will not be in vain. As I said the money is used to free up time to work on the game instead of having to make money otherwise and even an amount of just 100 Euro will take 1-2 weeks off the waiting time as it allows me to work 1-2 days fulltime on the game. So even in the worst case this campaign already has shortened the waiting time for the next release.

Cars Incorporated will definitely be completed. Over 60 people have already preordered and paid for the game prior to this campaign and I owe it to these people to see this project to it's proper end. Even preparations for actually producing the boxed version have been done and at least a small batch of 300 copies will be produced, more depending on how well they sell. So yes: All perks will be fulfilled.

The only difference is how long it takes for the game to be completed and whether or not there will be an add-on. So contribute now and help spread the word to fast-track the development of Cars Incorporated.

But even without contributing to this campaign you can support Cars Incorporated by simply making people aware of it. And you can even win the game in digital and boxed versions, T-Shirts, access to development steps between releases and - if the campaign is successful - even cash prices paid from my own pocket.

All you have to do is use the tools provided by Indiegogo further up on this page to promote this campaign. If you are logged in when doing so Indiegogo can track how many people you sent here. Just be sure to send them here, not to the game's homepage as that can not be counted by Indiegogo.

For each referral (unique visitor) you will receive 1 point. Every Euro contributed by one of your referrals (limited to those Indiegogo could track) will give you 5 points. The 5 highest ranking people at the end of the campaign will receive the following prices:
1. Price

Will receive the Perk ""The Big Box"" for free. This includes immediate alpha-access, an autographed boxed copy with your key once the game is completed, access to the development versions and a cool T-Shirt with one of your ingame build cars on it.
If the campaign raises the initial goal of 6.600 Euro the winner will also get 100 € from me by PayPal or German/EU wire transfer (not taken from the funds raised).
2. &
Will receive the Perk ""The Inner Circle"" for free. This includes immediate alpha-access, a boxed copy with your key once the game is completed, as well as access to the development versions
If the campaign raises the initial goal of 6.600 Euro the 2. and 3. price winners will also get 50 € each from me by PayPal or German/EU wire transfer (not taken from the funds raised).
4. &
Will receive the Perk ""Alpha Package"" for free. This means a digital copy of the game with immediate alpha access.

All funds raised by this crowdfunding campaign will go into the faster development and growth of Cars Incorporated, as well as into the further expansion of the game and the covering of production costs for physical perks.

Hitting this target will allow me to concentrate on the development for at least half a year. This will get the game into or at least close to the Beta Phase in the first quarter of 2014. Upon arriving in the beta phase all major features will be implemented.
Hitting this target will not only decrease the time required to get into Beta but it will also increase the amount of detail I can care about during development.

Hitting this target will take the game all the way to the finish line, giving me the funds and time I need to get the game through the Beta Phase and on to the release version 1.00. When the game hits version 1.00 a limited amount of physical copies and other physical perks will be professionally manufactured and sent to those who ordered them.
This point will be reached eventually even if no or not enough funds are raised, but hitting this target will greatly speed things up.

If this target is hit, the game will be produced in one run and upon completion the add-on that is currently under consideration will be produced immediately. The add-on will add a driving simulation to the game, allowing you to test your cars or drive them in races yourself. It will also expand the playable timespan into the future and add future technologies to the new game years.

Funds received beyond the required goals for completing the game AND the add-on will of course not go to waste. In fact there are many ways how more funds would benefit the game. Starting with additional time to make an even better game at no extra wait since most of you can play all the alpha versions, all the way to potential paid help such as a composer or a graphics artists to make the game even better. If it appears likely that more than 15.000 Euro will be raised you can post your ideas on how to use the money to improve the game in the comments, additional stretch goals will be added.
Funds that remain after Cars Incorporated is finished and I don't see other ways to improve this game will be used on my next game.

Most of the planed features such as an ingame newspaper, stock markets, a patent system or bulk orders (e.g. by the police or a cab company) will be added over time, usually in smaller updates. Below you will find a short list of the main targets for the major updates.
v0.30 - Components Update

(Already in development) This update will introduce small components. Some of these will need to be placed in the body editor such as mirrors or headlights. Others can be added to improve your cars in general such as turbo-chargers or seat belts.
This update will also add the 3rd body generation and increase the playable timespan to 1950.
v0.40 - Community Update

This update will let the game go online (if desired). It will include multiplayer sessions by internet, allow you to share your successes via social media or add your topsellers to an online-highscore.
You will also be able to upload your companies from completed games and let your friends or strangers try to beat your best game. Or you can try to beat your old company yourself.
v0.50 - Body Trim Update
Add chrome trims to your newest cars and merge wheel houses with the main body while you take the 4th body generation all the way to 1970.
v0.60 - Media Update
With all the major elements in place this update will finally remove all the place holder graphics and replace them with much better looking, final elements, created for the most part with Blender.
Bigger screen resolutions, new backdrops, sounds, music and a limited amount of animations will give the game a much more refined look.
v0.70 - 80s Update
The car as a box. In the big times of the angular designs, body generation 5 will take you through the 70s and 80s, adding lots more of technical gagdets to the cars.
v0.80 - Beta Update
A headlight designer will allow you to make your cars even more individual for the final decades of the game taking you to 2020 with the 6th body generation.
With the arrival of v0.80 all major features will be integrated and the game status will change from alpha to beta. At this point the Beta package perk will yield keys to these supporters.
v0.90 - Home Stretch Update

The final ideas and player wishes that have come up during beta testing will be implemented. Further updates will concentrate on fixing final bugs while the game officially moves from beta versions to release candidates.
v1.00 - Release Update
This is the release version that will be delivered in boxes to those that ordered the Boxed Version or higher perks including it. Only minor updates and fixes are expected at this point.
The Add-On

If it is financially viable (e.g. because the Add-On-Stretch-Goal has been met) the development will continue on an Add-On that will let you drive your cars in races or just for fun. It will also expand the game time into the future and add some futuristic technologies to the game.
If it gets made it will be free to all who supported this project with € 10 or more and to all who preordered during the alpha phase.
If you are wondering what you can do to help this project beyond contributing your hard earned money (or instead of if you don't want to or can't afford to help this way), here are some suggestions:
<ul>

• Use the tools on this page to help promote this campaign. Everyone who knows about this campaign could be the one that turns the tide and makes this game happen really fast. This can also get you the game and other prices in the referral contest. (see above)
• If you have questions about the game or this campaign you can ask me about them in the crowdfunding forum thread, in the comments of this campaign or on the game's homepage or facebook page.
• Let me know what other perks you would like to see
• Like the game on facebook or use the sharing tools on the game's homepage to let your friends know about this game.
• Talk about this game. On other websites, in gaming related message boards or to your friends in real life. Let everyone know about it.
• Join the game's message boards on the game's website and posts suggestions about the game for all players to see. Report bugs and your thoughts about it to help me improve the game.
PLAY the game

Essentially everyone who knows about the game and this campaign can help because as of right now the main problem for the game and this campaign is a lack of exposure. And so everything that brings in more people will in turn help the game as well. And you if you participate in the referral contest.

","Cars Incorporated is a business simulation game in which you can design, build and sell cars. It's inspired by classic simulations like Detroit and Motor City. A chain of thoughts on how to grow from these classics has lead to a unique approach on how to build your cars ingame:
A semi-free body editor and components derived from tech-levels with improvable properties truly make your cars your cars.
In the game you can...
...see how your cars hold up against the competition in a simulated market that is based on what the cars in it can actually do.
...let your cars compete in simulated races and see how well they hold up to the competition in this field.

...sell cars on all 6 continents and become the greatest car manufacturer of all times in a game that will ultimately span the entire history of the automobile from 1900 all the way to 2020 (the current alpha version ends in 1930, the next major update v0.30 will end in 1950) and possibly beyond (an add-on is under consideration).
You can already try out many of these features in the current alpha version, representing the state of development.

This game has been in development for 2.5 years and has released an update every 1.5 months on average since it's first alpha release in late 2011. It has received nothing but positive feedback and praise by the few people who stumbled upon it and has even been called highly addictive and more stable than most game's beta or even final versions. But you can try the first 5 game years right now, or play without limits if you preorder or contribute to this campaign, selecting a perk with alpha access.
(15.3 MB, Windows XP/Vista/7/8, German/Englisch)
Cars Incorporated is in active development for Windows XP, Vista, 7 & 8 and supports 32 and 64 bit. It requires the latest version of DirectX 9.0c.
If you don't know how to play you can watch a short Tutorial video.

About The Campaign
<h4><b>The Reasons, the Goals and How the Funds
are Utilized.
I had the original Idea for this campaign while working on a
game art package that I hoped I could release, which would bring in the
occasional donation that would lead to saving enough for a new computer. Over the following weeks I had bigger and
better ideas on how to go about procuring those funds and it became more and
more about releasing an enormous art pack that was crowd-funded, crowd-directed
and (until it was finished) crowd exclusive.
I want to reward people with more than just
game art that I needed or wanted to create. I want them to tell me what they
need in that art pack and to receive more than just an ""I'll take that
into consideration."" You fund the art, you get to tell me what to create
using simple rewards that go up in price as they get claimed. Whether you want
more character customization or a mansion with hidden passages, you can have
it. All you need to do is contribute and pick your perk. Then, when I ask you
what you want, tell me. Don't hold back. Challenge me, because this is also a
means by which I aim to improve my capabilities. When all of the perks are
fulfilled I want an urge to recreate the earliest works to present itself. When
all is said and done, I want to think ""I can do that much better than
before"".
Some ever-so-handy bullet points follow below for more concise
information about this campaign <span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >and the art. Then, a little about me.

column1: <h4><b>This is what funders with a contribution of
$5 or more will receive:
<ul>
<li>The
timed-exclusive, restriction-less rights to use all the art that gets
created through this campaign within your own game development projects.
To be released as it is created, exclusively to funders until all rewards
are fulfilled at which point it is released to
the public under the public domain(CCO License).
Check out the perks to see what custom art is up for grabs. The earlier the bird, the lower the required contribution will
be. When all of the limited quantities of a perk are chosen, the perk
will be reintroduced with a higher required contribution being necessary to
choose it. The amount will not exceed what a fair price for such a
commission would be and they definitely begin very cheap.
<h4><b>The funds from this campaign are used as
such:
<ul>
<li>The funds, up to
the goal amount, will be used for me to get a new computer and set aside
enough to replace the components my pen tablet should something break. I
currently have a laptop that was gifted to me a few years ago. It was
nothing special then, and now it is really showing it's age and price tag.
It slows down consistently while using the programs required to create the
art and this makes everything I do take more time. It was enough to get me
into digital art with a cheap pen tablet and I would like to build a new
computer that will keep me in digital art for the next
few years. Nothing too fancy, but strong enough to not need replacing over
the next few years, which is easily doable as I will build it myself with
a friend that has done it multiple times.
<li>I have some
awesome stretch goals in mind that could very well be their own
crowdfunding campaigns. Hopefully, I will get to present them here.
<h4><b>Why flexible funding? What if the goal
is not reached?
<ul>
<li>I chose flexible
funding so that even if only one person contributed just enough for one
creation, I would be able to honor that contribution the way I intended to
from the beginning. By rewarding them.
<li>If the goal
is not reached, nothing changes. I simply don't get the
new computer until I can save up the difference, which may take forever

but one step closer is better than standing still. However the closer the campaign gets to the goal, the more art that will be created and released. If the current batch of 40 bundle rewards all get picked up, there will be over 200 assets in the package. The individual parts of characters and tiles of tile sets are not counted separately. A full tile set is one asset as is a character or an object.
About The Art
The game art style has been chosen for both maximum ease-of-use

and ability to customize. As well as for my love of the projection in general. It allows 4, 8 or even full 360 degree movement, action and exploration which provides a bunch of game developing opportunities. Also because I haven't seen a pack in a similar style that contains more than the basics while plenty of strictly side-view art is out there.
<ul>
<li>
<b>Vector
Origins - Any size can be derived from just the one original
working file when using vectors. It is also much easier to make small
edits such as recolors if you so desire.
<li>
<b>Consistent Style
Across All Assets - No more struggles to find free art that
looks like it was made by artists with the same vision. Whether the game
you make is about cavemen, aliens or both, you can rest easy knowing the
game will have a consistent appearance. The rules by which the art is
created will also be made available so that any one can make meaningful
additions to the set. Also, while pixel art is great it is uncommon to
find top down art that isn't pixel art, let alone a set
that you helped create and expand.
<li>
<b>Parts Based
Animation - Rig your character up like puppets or use
pre-animated sprite sheets. Each has their pros and cons which is why
I will provide the components of both. This also allows the mixing and
matching of pieces from different characters. Even facial features can be
swapped depending on what the developer or even player wants since
implementing a character creator for your game or randomly generating
enemies with slightly different appearances will be a breeze. An army of
clones no more!
<li>
Interchangeable - For
example: The walls and the corner pillars of the walls are
interchangeable. The red walls can be matched to the grey, square pillars
and so on. This means that for each wall set that gets created, the new
pillars can be mixed with the old walls and the old pillars can be mixed
with the new walls. The best part is that I will create a new pillar set
with each wall set that gets directed by a contributor, and vice versa.
Ground sets can also be mixed thanks to transparency meaning no
foreseeable “transition tiles” will be necessary.
<li>
<b>Genre
Independent - Whether you wish to create a side-scrolling beat'em
up, an RPG, an endless runner or a shooter
column2: You can do so with this art.

column1:
How will the art be distributed? 

The art will be sent through emails as a link to download.  After the campaign and for as long as it takes to finish perk fulfillment, you will receive a weekly email that contains 2 links. One to download only any new art for that week and another to download the entire asset pack, including those newest items.

How will the ""directing"" work? 

The directing will work through email, Skype, Facebook or any other suggested means of communication through one, or a combination of three following methods. You can fill out a detailed form that I have created, send me sketches or pictures that show what you mean and/or you can simply type out all you want. I recommend using all 3 as it will surely allow me better comprehension of what it is you have in mind. I will not recreate copyrighted characters, etc. in this campaign art's style as the point is to expand an art package that you can use within any game development project. That art would not be eligible for such distribution.

What is in the pack so far?

facing four directions for the base character  (Idle &amp

","(Update 1 contains updated information on this campaigns perks!)About The Campaign
The Reasons, the Goals and How the Funds
are Utilized.
I had the original Idea for this campaign while working on a
game art package that I hoped I could release, which would bring in the
occasional donation that would lead to saving enough for a new computer. Over the following weeks I had bigger and
better ideas on how to go about procuring those funds and it became more and
more about releasing an enormous art pack that was crowd-funded, crowd-directed
and (until it was finished) crowd exclusive.
I want to reward people with more than just
game art that I needed or wanted to create. I want them to tell me what they
need in that art pack and to receive more than just an ""I'll take that
into consideration."" You fund the art, you get to tell me what to create
using simple rewards that go up in price as they get claimed. Whether you want
more character customization or a mansion with hidden passages, you can have
it. All you need to do is contribute and pick your perk. Then, when I ask you
what you want, tell me. Don't hold back. Challenge me, because this is also a
means by which I aim to improve my capabilities. When all of the perks are
fulfilled I want an urge to recreate the earliest works to present itself. When
all is said and done, I want to think ""I can do that much better than
before"".
Some ever-so-handy bullet points follow below for more concise
information about this campaign and the art. Then, a little about me.
This is what funders with a contribution of
$5 or more will receive:
The
timed-exclusive, restriction-less rights to use all the art that gets
created through this campaign within your own game development projects.
To be released as it is created, exclusively to funders until all rewards
are fulfilled at which point it is released to
the public under the public domain(CCO License).
Check out the perks to see what custom art is up for grabs. The earlier the bird, the lower the required contribution will
be. When all of the limited quantities of a perk are chosen, the perk
will be reintroduced with a higher required contribution being necessary to
choose it. The amount will not exceed what a fair price for such a
commission would be and they definitely begin very cheap.
The funds from this campaign are used as
such:
The funds, up to
the goal amount, will be used for me to get a new computer and set aside
enough to replace the components my pen tablet should something break. I
currently have a laptop that was gifted to me a few years ago. It was
nothing special then, and now it is really showing it's age and price tag.
It slows down consistently while using the programs required to create the
art and this makes everything I do take more time. It was enough to get me
into digital art with a cheap pen tablet and I would like to build a new
computer that will keep me in digital art for the next
few years. Nothing too fancy, but strong enough to not need replacing over
the next few years, which is easily doable as I will build it myself with
a friend that has done it multiple times.
I have some
awesome stretch goals in mind that could very well be their own
crowdfunding campaigns. Hopefully, I will get to present them here.
Why flexible funding? What if the goal
is not reached?
I chose flexible
funding so that even if only one person contributed just enough for one
creation, I would be able to honor that contribution the way I intended to
from the beginning. By rewarding them.
If the goal
is not reached, nothing changes. I simply don't get the
new computer until I can save up the difference, which may take forever

but one step closer is better than standing still. However the closer the campaign gets to the goal, the more art that will be created and released. If the current batch of 40 bundle rewards all get picked up, there will be over 200 assets in the package. The individual parts of characters and tiles of tile sets are not counted separately. A full tile set is one asset as is a character or an object.
About The Art
The game art style has been chosen for both maximum ease-of-use

and ability to customize. As well as for my love of the projection in general. It allows 4, 8 or even full 360 degree movement, action and exploration which provides a bunch of game developing opportunities. Also because I haven't seen a pack in a similar style that contains more than the basics while plenty of strictly side-view art is out there.
Vector
Origins - Any size can be derived from just the one original
working file when using vectors. It is also much easier to make small
edits such as recolors if you so desire.
Consistent Style
Across All Assets - No more struggles to find free art that
looks like it was made by artists with the same vision. Whether the game
you make is about cavemen, aliens or both, you can rest easy knowing the
game will have a consistent appearance. The rules by which the art is
created will also be made available so that any one can make meaningful
additions to the set. Also, while pixel art is great it is uncommon to
find top down art that isn't pixel art, let alone a set
that you helped create and expand.
Parts Based
Animation - Rig your character up like puppets or use
pre-animated sprite sheets. Each has their pros and cons which is why
I will provide the components of both. This also allows the mixing and
matching of pieces from different characters. Even facial features can be
swapped depending on what the developer or even player wants since
implementing a character creator for your game or randomly generating
enemies with slightly different appearances will be a breeze. An army of
clones no more!
Interchangeable - For
example: The walls and the corner pillars of the walls are
interchangeable. The red walls can be matched to the grey, square pillars
and so on. This means that for each wall set that gets created, the new
pillars can be mixed with the old walls and the old pillars can be mixed
with the new walls. The best part is that I will create a new pillar set
with each wall set that gets directed by a contributor, and vice versa.
Ground sets can also be mixed thanks to transparency meaning no
foreseeable “transition tiles” will be necessary.
Genre
Independent - Whether you wish to create a side-scrolling beat'em
up, an RPG, an endless runner or a shooter

Trash Monsters is a mobile game app for environmental education that may be enjoyed by users of all ages and it is structured to naturally learn how to separate trash while playing the game
column9:
/> 

Yum, Yum, Yum. They will eat it all up!
They are not your familiar monsters
They are the new and improved version of the garbage-eating Zombie, Trash-greedy Frankenstein, Gobble-Gobble Can-Can and even the litter-muncher Food waste man.

Which one of these monsters are hungry for paper and which one of these monsters will devour a ton of plastic? It is your job to find their favorite waste element and feed it to them.

There are 4 monsters and they will eat up all the plastic, can, paper and food waste if you know who eats what. Without wasting a life away, if you process all the trash, you clear the stage and move on to the next round.

But, what if you fail? Watch out! Because if you do, the creepy-crawly army of bugs will appear. Luckily you will be given 7 seconds to wipe out the bugs for some bonus points.
column10:
/>


CED is the abbreviation for Creative Entertainment Developer, and is a company that develops game apps meeting the Company’s goal, so-called “3E” (Eco, Education, and Entertainment). The Company is characterized in that it has no expenditure for capital, since six  High school(Hankuk Academy Of Foreign Studies) students having technology to develop apps are independently responsible for game development, promotion and sales.

What we need and Why

CED business will basically generate revenues through advertising revenues via apps and partial billing.  we will not simply develop Trash Monsters but will commercialize characters of the game to expand the business to character business. Moreover, CED will release several sequels to Eco Trash Monsters.

Short Summary

I was diagnosed with testicular cancer about a month ago. Went straight into surgery and had one testicle removed. We thought we got it all but now it looks like it has spread to the lymph nodes in my gut. I was building a computer for my own use/ school project but now I have no money to finish it since medical bills are expensive and my whole savings for the pc are gone, along with me having to quit my job since it would be dangerous to my welfare on chemo. I am seeing if maybe everyone chips in here and there I can get a graphics card and a hard drive (have an ssd from awhile ago) so i can finish the computer and it keep me occupied.

What I Need

Whatever you can afford to give without it affecting you in any negative way. This isn't an ""I need"" or ""Life or death"" project. Its just so I have something to do when I have to be alone during chemo because my immune system will  be compromised. If the total money raised cannot buy me anything then it will be going straight to medical bills, if it exceeds what is needed then the difference will be put towards medical bills

The Impact

The feeling that you are helping a person who is less fortunate than you and is going through a rough situation is all i can promise.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word.

Your kind words

Any tips on how to make chemo easier on my body and things to watch out for while on chemo. Email them to me at iedennin@gmail.com

Okay. Well. That was nuts. 3.5x the goal in 24 hours. Many, many thanks for your generosity. I'd encourage you to check out some of the comments in the post we made on Field Gulls to promote this indiegogo. The outpouring of gratitude to Danny says it all.
Okay, so that's that. What's next?

The new goal is $2,500 for the purpose of throwing a very excellent party (food, kegs, commemorative t-shirts?!) for the extended Field Gulls Writer's Guild. Show your support for the guys who make sure there is something new to read almost every time you load the site.

What?

Yeah, man. We should send this dude to a Seahawks game. Basically Danny Kelly has provided Seahawks fans with the following things
• Deeper understanding of the game, and the type of football Seattle plays
• Genuinely the best online sports community in existence
• If you like to write about the Seahawks, a platform on which to do so
• Consistently great Twitter avatars

Okay, but why?

Look we don't need to make a big thing of this. Consider it a gratuity, a fistbump, a tip of the cap. If you think he has enriched your favorite hobby, drop a few bucks in the hat.
That's absurdly compelling, stud. How much?
We are trying to raise $500. This gets the guy and a friend through the turnstile, covers some beer and travel expenses, no muss no fuss. Oh, you meant how much should you donate? I dunno, 5 bucks?
What's in it for me?
Unbelievable. Really? Nothing. There's nothing in it for you, we just thought it would be fun to do something nice. Good grief.
What if we miss the goal?

Whatever we raise still goes to Danny for a gameday pizza party, or something less stupid than that idea. Indiegogo takes 9%.

What if we make the goal?
Indiegogo takes 4% and Danny is going to a Seahawks game.
What if we CRUSH the goal?
Indiegogo takes 4%, Danny to game, other beloved Field Gulls writers get to join the fun.

I was born and raised here in Idaho Falls. I have always had an interest in computers. When I was twelve years old I built my very first computer. Now I am nearly fluent in C++ and my skills are always growing. I have always been coming up with new wacky ideas that will never work but when I came up with this. I thought that maybe with a bit of dedication, hard labor, and even more labor I could make it work.

This is the very first minecraft server of its kind. Where you the people decide the rules and rule over your own kingdom. You can actually change the entire server. If you have a new idea we can implement it. if you have problems you can get them solved.

The $500 dollars will cover all of the equipment i need to run a server of that size, running the server, and maintaining it.

If you have any questions email me at creeper.deaths@gmail.com

About Us:
column3:
/>

Will: My trail name is ""Dad."" I have hiked 350 miles on the AT during the Spring of 2014, but had to leave the trail because of injury. After leaving the trail, I acted as a shuttler for hikers around the Port Clinton/Hamburg, PA area. Prior to hiking the trail, I was involved in the BSA for 13 years, as a scout, scout leader, and camp counselor.
column5:
/>

Dale: Her camp nickname is ""Alpha."" For the past few years, Alpha has been a counselor at a Girl Scout camp that actually sits right next to the trail in PA. She's a long-time lover of the outdoors and nature. Her hope is that she will be able to experience the various cultures that meet along the trail. She is also a big fan of pandas.

column1: <span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Both of us are looking forward to putting our outdoor skills to the ultimate test on this amazing adventure.

column1: We are looking to hike the Appalachian Trail between May and August 2015. We will be saving money ourselves from our various jobs, but any help would be appreciated! As recent college grads, it is difficult to put money away with things like student loans, rent, and general cost of living expenses.
This campaign is focused on covering the cost of our rent and bills while we are away for the months it will take us to hike the trail, as well as helping us pay for food and other trail necessities.
We will also be keeping a log of our journey (both before and during) on a blog that will be created and updated regularly by both of us, so keep updated on our progress!

What is Clickinity?

Clickinity has one simple goal, to see how high we can get the counter to go. Now, this may seem like an odd goal but there is a reason within our madness. Call it a social experiment, thought exercise, or blatant curiosity. But really all we wanted was to see how many people we could get together to push a button as much as possible, to have one common goal.

How to play?

Players will have a certain amount of clicks and then you can use those to click The button. Every time you click the button, it will increase The counter by 1. It's that simple. 

Now here's the fun stuff. At certain check points or ""goal numbers"" the person who clicked The button to reach it will get a prize.                                                                                                                              So for an example: Let's say that 5000 is a :goal number."" The counter is at 4999 and you click the button so it reaches 5000. You are the 5000th clicker so you win a prize!                                        The best part is, the higher everyone can get the counter to go, the better the prizes. Imagine what the prize would be if someone reaches INFINITY!!!!!!!!!!!!

There are sooo many other features like:
- Account Levels
- Community Goals
- ""Hidden numbers""
- Holiday Themes
- etc.

Who are we?

We are Singular Unity LLC, a company that was started early in 2016, and created by a group of college students who early at 3am in a diner, brain blasted an amazing idea! The idea for the app came before the idea for the company, we thought about something that is simple, and added people into the mix. We wanted to create a community out of nothing, because games and projects are just more fun if people are involved. 

What’s the point?

If the goal is to just have a counter go as high as possible why not do this yourself? I hear many people saying this. The point is not just to have a counter tick up one click at a time, the goal is to have a group project where the collective clicks move it forward. As an added bonus for participating, at certain numbers, prizes will be awarded to the winning clicker.

Why do we need your help?

The money that comes in for the app goes towards the app which means many things:

- Finishing App Development
- Paying For Animation and Artwork
- Purchasing Prizes
- Processing Fees / Legal Fees
- As well as anything else to fully launch and support the app.
- Media Exposure (so more people can play and help the counter skyrocket) 

What can be expected if goals are met or beyond? If the goal is reached, we will be able to 100% complete the app with our current scope in mind. If over-funded, we will make sure these prizes are going to be straight fire. (We will also be able to add in more features into our app)

Closing remarks

Thanks for reading through our story and why we're here. If you're interested at all then please help us. As college students who struggle with classes, tests, and finances, it will help us immensely  if you donate (there's some good stuff in it for those who do). If you don't feel like donating (or are as broke as we are), we would be very thankful and appreciative if you spread the word.

Sincerely, The Singular Unity team.

 

Follow Us!

Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/Clickinity-1674060729588650/?fref=ts

Website: http://singularunity.com  or http://clickinity.com

Call it a social experiment, thought exercise, or blatant curiosity. But really all we wanted was to see how many people we could get together to push a button as much as possible, to have one common goal.How to play?Players will have a certain amount of clicks and then you can use those to click The button. Every time you click the button, it will increase The counter by 1. It's that simple. Now here's the fun stuff. At certain check points or ""goal numbers"" the person who clicked The button to reach it will get a prize.                                                                                                                              So for an example: Let's say that 5000 is a :goal number."" You are the 5000th clicker so you win a prize!                                        The best part is, the higher everyone can get the counter to go, the better the prizes. column5:
>What is 'The Sounds of Silence?'

'The Sounds of Silence' is a brilliant psychological horror game taking place in an asylum.  The game adapts to your movements and actions to test and discover your weakest fears and alters itself to provide a truly frightening experience.

Releases

The game will be released on PC, Mac, Linux, PSN, Steam, Xbox, Ouya, and mobile!

CHARITY : Water Campaign

Our team will donate over half of ALL profits of the game to charitywater.org.  This includes half of the IndieGoGo funds raised!  Charitywater.org is a non-profit organization on a mission to bring clean and safe drinking water to every person on the planet.
column7:
/>

Backstory

The nightmares--they're getting worse.  As a child they were filled with shadows. . . things from the dark--watching me.  But as I got older the figures, shadows, started following me, sometimes chasing me into the dark.  The dreams slowly became more violent.  The hands would grab onto me and pull me into the darkness while figures were scratching, screaming at me.  I'd wake up at different places.  I'd never remember how exactly I got there.  My parents were obviously very worried about me, but the doctors would convince them it was just sleepwalking and night terrors.  ""Kids go through this all the time.  It'll pass after a while,"" they said.  Yeah, right.  I began to have incidences at school. My parents sent me to a psychologist to discuss the things that were happening to me.  I told him the truth--that I could hear voices, not just in the dreams, but even while I was awake.  They'd follow me walking down the hallways alone or going to school.  Everywhere I was I felt like I was being watched.  The psychologist first thought that I was schizophrenic, but without the family history, he said that I did not fit the profile--the facts just didn't add up.  Maybe I was schizophrenic.  Maybe I was crazy.  Even so, after all this time, what if it is real?  Are the shadows really following me?  Are the voices I hear ghosts, or spirits, or something?  Are they real?  Is SHE real?  Only recently I have started to see more than shadows. . . I saw her--a girl in the dark.  I didn't see her clearly at first, but later on I could see her more fully.  I could see the details on her face.  I could hear her voice clearly now.  I was not mistaken, it was ALWAYS her.  I think I can almost feel her presence.  My god!  Am I going crazy!?. . . or is this real?  And if so, who is SHE--what is SHE, and what the hell does SHE want with me!?

Demo Scenes

*These scenes have been stripped to 'terrible' graphics mode for web player versatility.

All scenes require the Unity Web Player plugin.  Download here

Click to test

Click to test

Game Mechanics

The object of the game is to survive and escape from your past.  There are many puzzles you will encounter, each with a different spirit that will tell you their story and either help you or kill you.  You will then solve these puzzles to escape and move onto another.  You will run into many different creatures throughout the adventure whilst you are being guided by the voice of a past life.  You will use everything you can possibly find to help you throughout your journey.  You will find different electronic devices (i.e. flashlights, infrared cameras, cell phones, etc.) to guide you through the atmospheric environment. You will be chased by spirits, causing you damage, and if you cannot escape you will surely perish.

Adaption/Game Alteration

This is something that no game has ever done before to this extent!  The game will deliver an intensely frightening experience by exposing the player to their deepest fears.  The game will discover those fears and then alter itself to play with the fears of the player.  For example, if the player has a fear of darkness and loneliness, the game will discover this by observing the players actions, their movements, the paths and routes they take, their strategies, or other things that are much more subtle.  Once the system has gathered information accordingly, it will begin to alter the game to present the player with their deepest fears.  When the game starts, the system will begin by tracking the players movements and places visited.  It will then start testing between different fears and seeing the players reactions towards them, altering itself to maximize the fear factor.

Alterations

The game maps will consist of many rooms and parts of which can be swapped for one another.  The game will swap the rooms to whatever the game believes the player would suffer from the most.  These parts will contain many interactive and non-interactive events that the player will experience if their 'fear meter' runs too high (i.e. loneliness, darkness, ghosts, spiders, ambiance, color).  The game will also test for different ambiances to see which one will scare you the most and apply it throughout!

We have calculated that there is over 607,019,550 alterations per interior that the player can adapt to!

Here is an example of the interior alterations
column9: >Right now, the team under 'The Sounds of Silence' is working on expanding the world and story, layering detail, and increasing the game’s fear factor. We are working diligently and rapidly to prepare the BETA for release to backers.
column10:
>

Suspense

Taking inspiration from our favorite game series, Silent Hill, 'The Sound of Silence' builds fear mainly with atmospheric effects and game mechanics.  Players sense the pursuit with the full power of the mechanics, creating dramatic shadows and lighting, and subtle visual cues. 

Why Back Us?

Immersion is the most important thing in telling a great story, which means that the game will have to be detailed and scary.   It is very important that we design and build a game that our fans want.  This requires a lot of will and most importantly, time.  This, of course, requires a lot of money.  Up to this point, our team has been working part-time.  As we are able to get money to fund this project we will be able to focus more on the game full time with much more detail.  The money will also help us reach Sony, Steam, and many other publishers.  The game will look and feel beautiful with only the best of all designs picked with constant, thorough testing in the development processes.  We will build the game around the ideas that players have provided from the builds we send out. This game showcases things NEVER seen in games before.  This could easily change games forever and change the meaning of a true horror game.

Risks and Challenges

Making a game takes a lot of time, which in turn costs money.  If we don't have enough funding the time may become an issue, but we will try to overcome these issues.

column1: What is YOU.FO?
YOU.FO (patent pending) is an
innovative sportsconcept, based on throwing and catching an aerodynamic ring
with specially designed sticks over distances of 10 to 30 metres. This requires
concentration, strength, flexibility and cooperation. The basic skills are easy
to learn but YOU.FO players continue to be challenged to improve their skills, and
to invent new game concepts as well. YOU.FO can be played one on one or in teams,
with goals or freestyle, in the citypark, on sportsfields or at the beach. You can play YOU.FO from the age of twelve.
Development of YOU.FO
Founder of YOU.FO, Bas Ruyssenaars, was on
summer vacation in 2010 when he recalled a game he had invented and played when
he was young. Bas and his son started improvising on the beach and the idea for
YOU.FO was born. <span style=""line-height: 1.45em
column2: >Once back home Bas set up a team of industrial

trainee sports teachers. Now, after two years of concept development and fine-tuning, YOU.FO is market ready.

column2: >A YOU.FO set contains two sticks made of aluminum frames, and a plastic, double-layered, aerodynamic ring. The weight of a stick is 600 gram and the weight of a ring is 160 gram.
column3: > As we value sustainable, environment friendly production processes, a lot of thought has gone into the production materials: recycling of all YOU.FO plastic components is guaranteed through the Return2Sender (R2S) recycle programme.
